It was a little weird because they had huge slices of serrano peppers on the top (my arch enemy!), but it was easy to push them to the side.  The tortilla chips were also really good (and freshly made).  Our server also offered us more chips when we ran out!

For lunch we both ordered the Taco y Taco combo, which is any two tacos with a choice of small chopped salad, cup of soup, or rice and beans.  I chose the pork carnitas and spiced steak tacos with a side of rice and beans.  Everything was delicious.  I enjoyed the pork taco more than the steak taco, but my friend felt the opposite way.  The rice and beans were good and well seasoned.  I washed everything down with a delicious Mexican coke!

So, the food was great and our server was attentive and friendly.  The only downside is the price.  I do think it is worth it, but I probably wouldn't eat here all the time.  They also charge a mandatory 20% gratuity.  I don't know why that bothers me so much.  I usually tip 20% anyways, but I hate it when it is not a choice.  Also, I think you should always tell your customers that when they sit down instead of at the end.
column265: I am a big fan of Pablo y Pablo. It's a rather fancy looking, very modern Mexican Restaurant with lots of vegan options on their menu. I have eaten here multiple times and enjoyed great meals on their Covid-friendly patio served by wonderful staff. Their vegan nachos are great, though my favorite are probably their charred Brokkoli Tacos. Definitely worth a visit!
column266:
I write this review in the context of a carryout order. We haven't eaten in here, but we get carryout all the time, probably twice per month. 

The taco's here are phenomenal. I highly recommend the fish taco. It has a light, crispy breading and the fish is always fresh and cooked perfectly. 

We've gotten most of the other tacos on the menu. They are all delicious, but the one I'd specifically like to highlight that was new when we ate there last night was the stone crab taco. I have never had a crab taco until last night, and the crispiness, flavors, texture, and garnish were all perfect. Top it with a lime and it was divine. 

We order the nachos regularly too. They are always generously covered with fresh ingredients and guacamole. The ratio of chips to toppings is correct. The chips are crispy and salty, but not overly so. 

Pablo y Pablo is great, we will continue to come back. Thanks for providing the neighborhood with great food and strong service!
column267: Honestly feeling crazy ripped off by Pablo y Pablo right now and their management could not care less. I ordered a BOWL of their chicken tortilla soup. This is what I got. This is damn near the size of a dipping sauce cup and I paid $12 for it. It was $9 for a BOWL as listed on their menu plus tax it came out to $10 and $2 was tipped so in total $12. When I saw it in the bag, I really couldn't believe it and told the hostess I had ordered a bowl. She said there was one size, I told her their menu said there were 2 and she insisted that there was just one. I took it up with what seemed to be the manager and I asked him if I really had to pay $10 for this and he said there was one size and their menu changed. If this was the $9 option then what did the $6 one look like? Smh
column268: Located along the front of some corporate building, this place has a fine patio that allows dogs (very important to me).  The servers were usually good, and the food was fine.  Biggest complaint: it was a bit fusion-y, not authentic Mexican-American cuisine like you'd get further south along the coast.
column269:
I stopped by for a solo brunch and they took wonderful a care of me! Even with only three front of house on staff they handled the insanely busy brunch rush! 
Food:
I ordered the halibut ceviche with fresh chips as well as a pork and fish taco. Everything was so fresh and flavorful. Then best part was the blood orange margarita I was served while waiting for my table. 
Covid:
Outdoor seating, very clean and sanitary.
column270:
I've always loved this place!! I recently became vegan, and now i enjoy coming here even more because of their great vegan selections! 

My husband and i came here on a Wednesday, right when they opened at 3pm. We're so used to seeing this place jam packed and we weren't sure if that was the case since the pandemic. We sat out on the patio and had the whole place to ourselves. 

Our server, Ray, was fantastic!! He also made our drinks and they were probably the best margs I've ever had. (And Sh*t I just realized they are probably not vegan! Beginners mistake, please ask your server about the sweeteners)!

Loved my vegan nachos + vegan chorizo and the broccoli taco. Hubby got the steak taco and pork belly banh mi. Wish we took pics but we were too busy stuffing our faces. Everything was so delicious!!
column271: I stopped by on a Sunday around 2pm and they were quite busy, but we were able to get a table right away. They have outdoor seating; 2 tents (mostly enclosed except for one side) and another area is open on all sides with a roof overhead. I sat in the area with roof cover because I felt safest there (lots of air flow).  I ordered chips and salsa, vegan broccoli tacos and a side of beans. The salsas (jalapeno and cascabel) and chips are very tasty and fresh. Their tacos were incredible. Lots of flavor and I love the cashew cheese. Their soft tortillas are some of the best in town. Service was friendly, but slow. Don't come here in a rush. I didn't mind the pace.  I took off one star because the cocktails were disappointing. The mezcal margarita tasted mostly like artificial sour mix and I couldn't taste any mezcal. The vino de olla (mulled wine) was watery and lacked flavor. The sangria was decent and it was the best out of the three, but I've had far better. That aside, I had a good time and I appreciate that they are open and offering safe outdoor seating during these difficult times. I'll come back for the excellent food.
column272:
I tried Pecado Bueno for the first time last night! The Fremont location has a lot of outdoor seating which is really great right now. 
For a drink I got a coconut mojito. It was REALLY coconutty which I really liked. Unfortunately it was $12 and they have a $5 margarita option so I felt like I couldn't justify more than one of the mojitos. 
We got chips and salsa to start out. We got guacamole as well which was SO good- I'm not even a huge guac fan but I still liked it. 
For dinner I got the breakfast wet burrito - I chose the cheese sauce to smother it in. They had two other options, and I think maybe I should've got one of those. The cheese was not the consistency I was expecting and just wasn't my favorite. The contents of the burrito were amazing though; the potatoes were my favorite thing I ate. Apparently they had a potato option for taquitos, so I think that'll be my next thing I try. 
Overall I really loved my experience here. I will definitely be back for $5 margs and to try more of the menu!
column273: Outdoor seating is a plus, their appetizers are so comforting!
column274: Food and ambiance are incredible all the time. I love that me and my dog Stanley can sit on the patio for a marg. I am amazed how well Kevin and Corey handle the college crowd during Covid times. They are so professional and friendly while enforcing the rules. This is an amazing spot with great staff and food. I'm so glad I live close!
column275:
My first time in Washington and well it's time to go back home (California) but of course I couldn't decline the opportunity to look for a great place to eat before saying good bye to this beautiful state. As a good foodie I went on Yelp and looked for food around and it came to Pecado Bueno. I called beforehand just to make sure we were able to dine in; they said yes and well we head out to this beautiful place. First of I want to start with how great the restaurant looks. It's simple yet elegant and the ambiance it's awesome. The wonderful man who helped us with our order suggested few popular items as i requested and all I can say I'm beyond satisfied. Not only was he friendly but his suggestion hit the spot. I ordered the stew (guisado) with extra rice, my fiancé ordered a Philly cheese steak torta which I also tried and God!!!! It was soft cheesy and the meat was soft and flavorful. My friend ordered a carne asada wet burrito and that thing was huge, also looked great, and I can assume it was delicious because he's a foodie like me and he finished the whole thing. We got complementary chips and salsa (habanero salsa) to start off while we waited for our food. Guys!!!! The salsa is bomb.com I ended up asking for more salsa and finished the whole thing, it's not as spicy as you would think; it has a kick to it but enjoyable and great with any food item. Food is overall affordable and worth every Penny. The music was so soothing. I love jazz so listening to it while I ate my food made me feel even more cozy and comfy.  I will definitely come back to this delicious place. 

P.S the bathrooms, I loved their sign it doesn't have a female or male sign it simply says whichever and I found it funny yet really great to be neutral. #Original.
column276:
I had been looking forward to trying Pecado Bueno for several weeks due to the lovely heated and covered patio.

Restaurant get very COVID conscious with sanitizer aplenty and spacing between tables.

We started with a round of margaritas and chips/salsa/guacamole. The margaritas were basic but delicious and the portion was generous. Average chips, salsa, and guacamole.

Not sure how to describe my burrito and my girlfriends tacos other than "run of the mill". Nothing really shocked me as great here, but it also wasn't bad.

Stop by certainly for the vibes, friendly staff, and patio. Don't make a special trip for the food.
column277:
I have ordered the Torta and tacos before but today I ordered the Baja Avocado Caesar
Romaine, avocado-caesar dressing, pico de gallo, cotija cheese, & avocado and Added grilled chicken and Omgosh  it will be my fave n only thing I'll order from now on lol
column278:
We were donated 90 meals to healthcare workers at my work today. We all greatly appreciate it the kind donation- and look forward to coming to your restaurant soon. 
The food was great and had so many options to choose from! 
Ps the picture doesn't do justice :)
column279:
was waiting in line and watching the cooks in the back with their masks pulled down as they were assembling food. This is on taco Tuesday, when it is the busiest. So, essentially exposing hundreds of customers to their droplets. I'm so pissed, especially as a past loyal customer, to know that I could've been eating the germs that have expelled from the line cooks mouths. Disgusting. Not Covid friendly. Would not recommend to anyone with a brain or conscious. 

Update: owner responsive and wants to handle the situation.. I will add a star for that effort and kindness.
column280:
Make the drive from Lynnwood to Fremont pretty regularly for these guys. 

Burritos are huge (easily two meals). The butternut squash is an amazing vegetarian option - filling, slightly sweet compliment and great texture. My husband and I both love the wet queso burrito.

Also, the pickled red onions and fruit salsa is a must!!
column281: Sorry, but your 3-taco plate very very disappointing. More like a corn tortilla with burnt meat, lettuce and tomato. I picked up my food for takeout and it was already cold. Sorry to say this but probably not eating here ever again.
column282: This place is definitely below average. We ordered the street tacos, quesadilla, ceviche, and horchata. We found a hair in the ceviche and the tacos were very dry and had absolutely no flavor. The ceviche didn't taste fresh at all and the quesadilla was soggy. I don't understand how so many people like this place. Not to mention the poor customer service. I recommend any other Mexican restaurant because this one just isn't it.
column283: I've been here a few times, but tonight was the first time I've ordered takeout from Pecado Bueno. I got the taco plate with cod in two tacos and shrimp in the third. I really enjoyed how fresh everything tasted and I preferred the cod over the shrimp because of the slaw that was on top - it was very citrusy and super yummy! The black beans are always great, and the plate also comes with rice but  I normally don't eat it because it has a lot of cilantro which I'm not a huge fan of, so I save it for last and am never hungry enough to eat any! I do wish they would use two corn tortillas for the tacos, because the tortillas don't hold up to the filling and often break. Two of mine completely broke and I had to eat them with a fork, and one I was able to (barely!) hold together. Overall, really yummy food and a good price for the amount that you get!
column284: No Bueno. Kind of disappointed. The flavor is okay. But as far as a door dash order goes, kind of a rip off. I've been up since 3am traveling and haven't eaten all day. Hunger is real. Placed an order on door dash at my hotel. Marked extra protein, chips and toppings. Absolutely no chips came. Definitely not "extra protein" portion served. This burrito bowl is in a side salad size container and the majority's beans and rice on the bottom to make it look over flowing. The salsa containers are almost the size of the "bowl." Food tasted okay. Just sucks spending over $30 and not getting your moneys worth. Definitely won't be back. Food on yelp looks great, so maybe skip doordash.
column286:
Came here for dinner with a friend on a weekday. My friend ordered a carne asada torta. I ordered a steak taco (cause it's taco Tuesday) and a ceviche.

The tacos (yes I got two because of the taco Tuesday) were very mediocre. The steak didn't have any flavor at all. Nothing else in the taco made up for that except for the price ($5.50 for two). If I paid the full price I would be super disappointed. My friend didn't like his torta either. I tried it and agreed with him - the bread was weird, there wasn't much carne asada, nothing great. The ceviche was okay but had extremely small portion. I felt I paid more for the tortilla chips that came with it.

Absolutely not authentic Mexican food, wasn't even good food either.
column287: This food tasted delightful but unfortunately me, my gf, and my buddy were immediately sick and for 4 days after sharing tacos, burrito, quesadilla. Very unpleasant experiences in the bathroom as well as trying to coordinate who was closest to danger (pooping in pants) and who had priority in the 1 bathroom we have access too. Believe it or not, we made a second attempt to eat here after thinking maybe our sickness was from something else or bad luck, we found that to be enormous mistake and we all experienced the same thing even from different dishes. So yeah, never again. Pecado no Bueno.
column288: Just got takeout from here and the tacos were so good. Also it was so nice to get the variety of salsas. The guac provided is quite small so probably wouldn't get that again, but it tasted great. Their black beans and rice on the side are also quite good. They provide plenty of chips and we had salsa left over. My boyfriend got the enchiladas and loved those as well.
column289:
Order at the counter, then seat yourself and wait for food. The chip bar with refillable basket of chips was a cool concept, but the chips were overcooked and hard/stale. The guacamole is tasty, and worth the couple bucks to add on! 

I ordered a burrito bowl and a fountain drink, but the employee never gave me a glass for the drink and walked away as soon as she put away the money I paid with so I didn't get the chance to ask her for one. I stayed at the counter hoping I could catch her attention and ask her for a cup, but after standing there awkwardly as more customers filed in behind me, I gave up and took a water cup that I filled with soda.

I went with a vegetarian burrito bowl, so instead of meat it's served with butternut squash. The squash was cooked well, but I don't think the flavors really match those of a burrito - I would much rather have some fajita veggies thrown in instead of the squash. The food was barely warmer than room temperature, but I bet it would taste much better if it was warm enough to melt the cheese a little on top!
column290:
I've had a hard time finding good Mexican since my move back to Seattle from the SF Bay Area.  Enter Pecado Bueno.

My wife craved Mexican on a cold Tuesday afternoon, and GMaps showed me PB was a couple miles away - an easy drive.  We walked in and asked the person behind the counter for a recommendation - it being our first time there, and all.  "Tacos!  It's Taco Tuesday..."  Sold.

2 fish tacos, a carne asada, and a carnitas later, we decided to come back for dinner some evening in the not-to-distant future.  Good value, too.  Our meal including chips & guac and an ice tea was under $20.
column291: Had the breakfast burrito. Ingredients tasted fresh and authentic. I have been hoping to find a good Mexican spot since moving from Chicago and this would have to be my top 5.
column292:
I love the barbacoa (lamb) tacos here! The tacos are big and with lots of meat.

Salsas are fresh and delicious!
column293: Love this place. Authentic mexican food at very reasonable prices. We normally get one pound of carnitas and one pound of barbacoa to go, and make tacos at home.
column294: My boyfriend and I love this place. Unfortunately, I had a bad experience today that I found something my mouth after I had a one bite of taco. I think it was bone or some tooth in my tacos. Luckily, I did not swallow it, but it hurt my upper mouth.
column295:
This place is such a hidden gem in Greenwood. Tucked in the back of a Mexican grocery store is La Conasupo. It's a no frills restaurant where you look at the menu on the board, decide what you want to eat and let the person at the counter know. She'll write the order in Spanish on a ticket and will tell you to go to the front of the grocery store to the cashier and pay. 
I discovered this place about 4 years ago and I almost missed it because it's along the main row of shops in Greenwood. If it's your first time there, I highly recommend getting the Quesadilla. It's literally the size of a half moon! Get the Quesadilla de Tinga de Res, which is shredded beef in the most amazing sauce. Add that to the cheese inside the quesadilla and it's absolute heaven...and messy. 
Since I ordered this so many times, I decided to get tacos on my latest trip. Tacos are about $6 each, so they're on the pricey side. However, these aren't your run of the mill street tacos that you can eat in one bite. They're about 2 1/2 times the size of those tacos and loaded with meat and onions and cilantro. When I ordered three, the lady at the counter warned me how big they were. The size of the tacos reminded me of the ones in LA where they just piled on the meat with several tortillas underneath. I chose Lengua, Cabeza, and Carnitas as my meats of choice, which are the top 3 I normally get. The tacos didn't disappoint. The container weighed about 3 lbs. total and I definitely over ordered. Two is enough for a hungry person. Also, beware of the red salsa. It is extremely tongue numbing hot. 
In the window is also chicharrons piled 2 feet high that they've fried from all the meats. They're literally the size of your head and bigger, so I got a pound of those to snack on. They're a bit hard, so you probably want to use them for cooking in stews, etc. instead of eating raw. 
Next time you're in Greenwood and you're craving Mexican, make sure you stop by here and grab a quesadilla or tacos. I'll need to go back and get some consome or menudo next time I go back!
column296: The food is great but the employees are not following law regulations. They don't wear mask specials the man at the register I think he is the owner.
column297:
Happy to have this place nearby our house. It's a great little Mexican market with a taco shop in the back. Tacos were alright. Not big fans of the lengua as it tasted boiled and super underseasoned. Still on the hunt for some good lengua. The carnitas were good but everything could use a touch of salt. 

However the horchata here is soooo good. Like I want to buy it in buckets. But maybe that's gross. I don't care. It's that good.
column298: This is the most authentic place in the city for Mexican market food, however its not welcoming.... most non Mexicans arrive and get intimidated and leave... my advice, it looks wired, but food is clean and delicious... give it a try
column299: I went to eat here because I was told the barbacoa was great. But it was ok at best. The service left a lot to desire and the is nowhere to sit and wait for a table to open up. Oh and there's like 8 tables and u can barely move when you sit! Did I mention the waitresses were rude af!? Anyways the trip was not worth it.
column300: This place is derty, and they charge more than other places. Specially on beer. Need to be cleaned.
column301: Went there on Sunday afternoon food is delicious, and good portions we split one taco de carnitas and a quesadilla de chicharrón. The aguas frescas are sooooo tasty they have passion fruit and it was wow!!!!!! Extremely recommend if u wanna try to a good mexican food
column302: Most authentic Mexican food you can find in the area by far. On sundays especially, this place is filled to the brim with Mexican families, half are seated, the other half are in a line that stretches all the way outside... that's how you know it's some good stuff. Hands down best (quality, quantity, taste, and price wise) quesadillas I've had in my life, resembles more of a calzone than the Americanized quesadillas you'll see in the vast majority of places. Their tacos seem to be priced high but the quantities u get for 1 taco easily makes 2 full size street tacos and then some. A+
column303:
La Conasupo is a haven for Mexican and Latin American immigrants. 

Like many immigrant businesses, their customer service is not up to fast food restaurants. Plus, if you don't speak Spanish you'll have to put on your patience-pants to get as close to what I know as a family-cooked meal. 

Tip: hit the cooler with drink containers of horchata, guayava, and jamaica. These are not powdered-made!

Tip #2: pay up front AFTER you eat or receive your take-out. 

Tip #3: The one veggie we tried was the hongos (ie, mushroom) quesadilla. Well done and packed with lots of them.
column304:
If you are looking for authentic Mexican food from Mexico City. this is the place to go to. Their food is amazing, very tasty and plentiful. 
Menudo or Consome with one of their carnitas or barbacoa tacos smothered with their super delicious green salsa on the weekend after a night of a few drinks is the best of the best! 
If you can get over the fact that you will be seating around a pile of empty boxes, unorganized shelf's, overcrowded isles, dirty floor and not the best customer service then you will have the best Authentic Mexican food.
column305: the food is delicious, the dishes are gigantic and the service excellent, very friendly the staff that works there, very cheap grocery productsAguas Frescas
column306:
I think I should have read the reviews more carefully: $4 seems like a lot to pay for one taco, but good lord do they make enormous tacos here. I quite foolishly ordered two. Each taco came on two rather large tortillas and the plate contained two more. Basically, you get enough meat with two tacos to make six more modestly-sized ones. You do the math: buy one gigantic $4 taco, and portion that into at least two, if not more. And yes, the red salsa is quite hot.  

So how were they? I got the carne asada, and as others have noted, they were a bit dry, although they did have the texture of tacos al barbacoa. Next time--and there will be a next time--I'll probably try the tinga de pollo quesadilla because that for sure should not be dry. Oh, and bonus points for the gigantic cups of guava drink and horchata in the back fridge, ready for the taking. 

The kitchen staff seems to speak limited English, FYI, but that's not really a hindrance to ordering or anything like that.
column307:
THIS is my best kept Seattle secret. 

Circa 2006, came here with a friend for "brunch". Now, when I say "brunch", it's not your typical sit down place, customize everything you want, add this, don't use that, speak in English etc. 

No, this is the most authentic Mexican brunch you will ever have in Seattle. I'm serious, the hot sauce is hotter than hot, there aren't any utensils (so yes, you make your taco by picking up the fresh, hot homemade corn tortilla, using that to scoop up the meat, add your cilantro, onions, chili's, and bite into the juiciest, most authentic, overstuffed taco (that's what you'll be when you leave) you will find in Seattle.

The Sunday brunch crowd is mostly families that come after church to have a family meal. Amo este lugar. I love the atmosphere here, too. Such fun place to eat and practice your Spanish.

Also, if you don't speak Spanish at least conversationally, you probably can't get food here. It's not impossible, but it's not optimal either and the menu is in full Spanish with no more than 5 items listed. Let me help you out!

"Hola, Por favor cinco tacos de carne asada (yes you want five tacos) con cebolla, cilantro, salsa picante verde y rojo (yes you want both kinds, especially the avocado green salsa). Gracias". Also this place isn't veg friendly. 

You will thank me. 

Also, if you go on Saturday, try the consomme, barbacoa (it's slow roasted, shredded lamb), and tacos dorados with crispy tortillas wrapped around spicy chiles and potatoes.The quesadillas on house made tortillas are also sososososo good. Just EVERYTHING. Eat it all. 

Just FYI, "dorados" means "golden". You will not find better gold in taco format in Seattle ever.

Drool. 

Drool.

PS Buy the fresh adobo and chipotle chili's. Mmmmm!

Me encanta este lugar a la luna y de regreso.
column308: So. Much. Meat. Not a bad thing, but extra tortillas aren't a bad idea. Homemade red and green salsas on the tables. I got the carnitas and thought they were a little dry, but salsa definitely fixed that. The bigger market had a ton of mexican specialty items, including COWBOY BOOTS... made my day!
column309:
Yikes.Went to the back to order some food...and while we were looking at their menu board some young woman who was mopping the floor started yelling at us: "Hellooo."  "Helloooo..."  I said hi, she muttered something in Spanish and said "helloooo" again.  So I said "hello" AGAIN.  And once more she chimed in with "Hellooo," like she was pissed off that we dared to be there looking at the menu.  I said, "we're looking at the menu."  She finally gave up with a grumpy face and retreated into the bowels of La Conasupo.  At that point we decided to exit.  Between the rude attitude and the dirty surroundings, we were glad to leave.  
    Do yourself a treat and go around the corner to Gordito's.  They treat you with dignity there and the place looked like someone cared....and the food at Gordito's was exceptional.  Ciao La Conasupo!
column310: It's my second time here and the first time was better. I got a carne asada tacos and the meet was to greasy and made it taste bad and I also got a quesadilla and it was good also a bit greasy but it had its balance with cheese and thicker outside. My bf had the consome and he didn't like the meat the flavor was off. I'm sad this went from good to bad
column311:
Here's the problem with Conasupo: Inconsistency! Sometimes their barbacoa, quesadilla, or menudo are good and sometimes the worst. How do you expect your customers to come back if we never know whether spending $50 on barbacoa would be worth it? The last 2 times my family went to Conasupo, the barbacoa was so dry and tasteless. We paid more than $50 for a Sunday lunch and it left a bad taste in our mouths. Needless to say, that is the last time we are ever going to this place.

I'd rather go to Bothell for the barbacoa.
column312: Had a few take out meals here, and it was fast and great everytime. The food is delicious, authentic, and reasonably priced. There is a road construction next to them, but the restaurant is open.
column313:
This place was a revelation.  This unassuming little cafe across from a fishing store and just a block from gasworks has delightfully tasty sandwiches and burritos. 

The $6.50 chorizo breakfast burrito stands out, every bite was perfect till the end. Delicious and comforting on a grey Seattle morning after a little too much wine the night before. 

A bit sloppy but otherwise *chefs kiss*
column314:
Usually I'm driving past this Northlake location heading to/from the University District heading to either Fremont or lower Queen Anne. 

I just started a new job nearby a little over a month ago, so I've been paying more attention to what's in the vicinity where Northlake meets up with Wallingford and Fremont. Mas Cafe is located along N 34th near Gasworks Park. Welcoming counter person, efficient kitchen crew, decent menu for such a pocket indie cafe. 

We walked over to Mas Cafe where the manager treated me and three other colleagues to lunch (2/10/21). They ordered burritos or tacos, I opted for the carne asada quesadillas ($8). The order came with onion/jalapeno/cilantro garnish, green salsa, and crema. Mammoth sized, chockful of meaty cheesy goodness, I was done in by a 1/4 portion. 

It was nice to sit outside to soak up sun rays despite the brisk breeze (=the calm before the snow event two days later). It was served on a foil wrapped paper plate, so I was able to transport it back to work and later home without any incident. The reheated leftover remained tasty. 

A pleasant find for breakfast, lunch, or coffee beverages featuring Mukilteo Coffee Roasters.
column315: That endless search for Seattle's best breakfast burrito ended at Mas Cafe. The flavor, the quantity and the price all rest in harmony. In fact, I've known about this place for months but withheld telling anyone other than close friends and family so as not to disrupt the delicate balance of culinary excellence and prompt service. In the past few years, I've spent a significant time in Mexico and with each bite of their magnificent burritos, you can almost feel the warmth and sunshine as if you were taking a stroll through the local malecon. If you ever get the chance to visit the Pyramid of the Sun in Mexico city, climb to the very top, breathe deep, and you might experience some of the passion that Mas Cafe brings to their small Seattle outpost.
column316:
One of the best breakfast sandwiches around! (And for great value in quality/toppings). Have been back multiple times. 
Friend got the al pastor street tacos and claims they beat her previous local favorites. So happy to have found this gem!
column317: Perfectly sized tasty breakfast burritos in a few different flavors at an excellent price! One reviewer said their burrito fell apart but my partner and I get burritos here at least once a week now and they've never fallen apart. They offer coffees and juices. Our new go to. Easy to access parking options. Order directly from them inside the shop or by phone--don't order online through an ordering service who increases the prices. The burritos are only ~ $5/6.50 but ordering through here they're ~ $8/9.50
column318: This place was pretty good, but wouldn't go out of my way to get food from here again. The shrimp fajita wrap was mostly lettuce, hardly any shrimp and it was wrapped up poorly. My husband really loved his chicken sandwich. I had a bite and it was quite good. Tried all the tacos and they were good. Nothing particularly special. If you're in the area and need a quick bite, go for it.
column319: I'm giving them Stars for amazing customer service and decent coffee. I ordered a breakfast burrito which was huge, that's usually a good thing unless the burrito completely falls apart upon first bite. You should use foil or something to keep it together. The eggs in the burrito were burnt and tasted like wet dog, the salsa and veggies were fine but I only had like 3 pieces of potato. Took 3 bites and threw it out. Maybe try their breakfast sandwich but don't go for the burrito.
column320:
Family-run cafe. Serving tasty hot breakfast sandwiches, wraps and burritos. 
We ordered the Huli Huli Chicken sandwich and the Avocado breakfast sandwich. Crunchy bread, and soft succulent and juicy chicken. The avocado sandwich was generously filled and perfect for eggetarians.
Loved their coffee from local suppliers. 
You've got to try their fresh carrot+orange+ginger juice.  
On a previous visit when they had just opened, we had tried their chicken burritos. Lip-smacking good.
1 street/block North of GasWorks main parking lot. They also have small parking area. I recommend just call ahead, park at GasWorks, grab your order and head over to the park to enjoy your meal.
column321: The juice was GREAT and the street Tacos very DELICIOUS when I'm in Seattle and want tacos This will be my go to !
column322: I cannot believe I've never been here before today.... I'm kicking myself for however many weeks/months/years I've been living within a mile of this place and NOT eating their food every day.  Got the bacon breakfast sandwich and one of the juice blends and wowwwewwwee holy wow this is beyond delicious. Already made a breakfast date to go back later this weekend. YUM!!!!!
column323: Visited Mas Cafe for the first time today for coffee and breakfast sandwiches. Breakfast sandwiches were really tastey and reasonably priced! Looking forward to having this place in the neighborhood to frequent often!
column324:
FINALLY! Mas Cafe has the best street tacos. They are the most authentic I've had since leaving Mexico.  Small double tortillas, flavorful meat choices, amazing onions and hot sauce on the side. This is as close to taco perfection as you will find. 
Please check it out. You will not be disappointed.
column325: The sandwiches are really good and flavorful. I recommend the Huli Huli and the egg sandwich. The brioche they use for the egg sandwich is so delicious. Tacos are delish. Great customer service, too.
column326: Amazing food at a great value! I've yet to find a menu item that I don't like. The flavors are amazing. A great addition to the neighborhood.
column327: Staff is very friendly here, I tried the tacos (one of each) and they were all superb; best street tacos in the area.
column328: $6.50 for an excellent breakfast burrito in Seattle? Pretty much unheard of.  Also I've been on the hunt for good Mexican food since moving here from Arizona and I'm happy to finally have found a spot. Would definitely recommend and will be back.
column329:
Casa Patrón is a great place to go for a casual night! I used to love coming here (pre-Covid) for nights with my girl friends! We usually just stick to drinks, but I finally came and got some food so I felt like I could leave an honest review. 
First off, the variety of drinks they have is amazing! Flavored mojitos/margs are my favorite things to see at a Mexican restaurant so it's nice they have lots of those options. Last time I came I got a jalapeño margarita and some cucumber mojitos. They were really tasty (and cheaper than a lot of other Seattle bars), but I didn't really feel all that tipsy. I ordered a chile relleno and it was pretty good too! The amount of food you get for the price is really solid, so I would say worth it. 
This place is a 4/5 star for me for two reasons. One, like I said I don't feel like the drinks are very strong. I wish they were worth the price, especially because they're really delicious! Second, I feel like while I was definitely satisfied with the food, it wasn't my absolute favorite Mexican food I've had at a more casual spot like this one. 
That said, I highly highly recommend Casa Patron for a fun night out with friends, or a casual date night! I really look forward to coming back for those once COVID is a little better.
column330:
Love Casa Patron! We used to have a difficult time straying away from this place for Friday date nights. The staff is always super friendly and accommodating, however a little slow sometimes, but that's a Friday night for you!
We usually get a combo plate that has a taco, enchilada, and tamale which also has rice and beans. Its super cheesy and delicious and we absolutely love it. 
Rating this a 4 star instead of 5 as the takeout isn't as great as the in-restaurant experience. Also, I have ordered so many different types of margaritas here and have never felt tipsy off them. I'd recommend sticking to beer!
column331:
Arrives at the restaurant at 8:00 pm I asked for a Mixed Ceviche I never arrive it is 10:00 pm and I still hope they bring the bill to pick me up since they served me a beer and I have to pay for it the waitress passes by me and it is as if  we were not here

Llege al restaurante 8:00 pm pedí un Ceviche Mixto nunca llego son las 10:00 pm y aún espero que traigan la cuenta para retírame ya que me sirvieron una cerveza y tengo que pagar por ella la mesera pasa junto a mi y es como si  no estuviéramos aquí
column332:
Food was great. Dine in seating.

Will be back for sure! 

The restaurant is very clean and the service was awesome!
column333: Great mexican place with authentic flavors and large variety of dishes.  Lots of great spicy kicks in most dishes if that's what you're looking for (i usually am).  Also fun decor and staff and a very fun bar area.  Plenty of easy parking out back.
column334:
Their service was pretty much trash. 
The waiter didn't even bother to bring us water until after the poorly made margaritas were in front of us for a couple sips...
The other waitress got hella attitude with me over me asking could we get some water before we put our food order in... idk maybe they was just up in there having a bad day but man this experience did not make me wanna go back at all...
They got both our orders wrong (drinks, and food).
They got the price at the end of the meal wrong which to me is wild cause everything up until now was also unsatisfactory. 

To be honest the only thing saving this review and my thoughts on this establishment was that the food was good. Tacos was nice and seasoned. No stale shells. ceviche wasn't too bad either. Ima have to go back again to see if it was just those particular employees!
column335: Be forewarned if you try to order takeout via Yelp. I placed an order tonight and even got a confirmation that my order was ready but when I arrived, the restaurant was closed. Apparently they close at 9pm (Yelp currently says midnight) but their system can automatically accept and confirm orders. GrubHub refunded my money but I wasted 45 minutes waiting for a non-existent order.
column336: Went around 10:15pm on a Friday for a late night bite with my partner. Restaurant had a good amount of people seated, conversations were lively. Unfortunately per Washington state law alcohol cannot be serviced after 10pm, which sucks, but that isn't in control of the restaurant. I ordered camarones a la diabla and it was SO GOOD. The rice and beans had amazing flavor and the salsa on the shrimp was delightful. Definitely tasted like authentic Mexican food. My husband got a patron burrito and he also loved it. Would go back. Service was great as well. :)
column337:
I have to give Casa Patron about a 2.5-3 stars. Unfortunately, my first experience was not the best. Overall, the atmosphere and staff are nice...no qualms there. It's the food that was below average. Our expectations were not super high as I know all too well this is an "americanized" Mexican joint. However, I would have expected a little bit better food with a 4-star rating? 

Chips: tasted rancid...like they were cooked in oil that had sat for too long and/or at too high of a temp. It had that weird smoky smell and taste. We did not eat these after the first bites and noticing. You could smell it the entire time it sat at our table. Not pleasing. 
Salsas - actually quite good. The chunky not-as-spicy dip along with the spicer salsa all had great flavor

Meals: so-so
Ground beef was extremely greasy
Tamale...it looked like the shredded chicken was simply laid on top of the masa and not actually inside the tamale? It was so covered in flavorless sauce and cheese it was hard to tell.
Beans & Rice...average.
Burrito and enchiladas...OK. Again, the sauce they cover these in did not have much flavor. Melted cheese helps I suppose. 

I would return here...maybe for a happy hour, but food was sub-par. Pricing overall was relatively cheap. Perhaps there are other options on the menu that may be better.
column338:
Food is good. Happy hour is great. 

HAPPY HOUR 2PM-6PM & 9PM-close everyday 

They have extremely friendly servers and also reasonably (seattle) priced food menu items.

As soon as I came in they handed me menus and chips & salsa. I ordered the taquitos on happy hour menu and it was just what I needed.
column339: I got the patron burrito with picadillo (shredded beef) in it. Nothing special about the burrito. It was good sized but like I said, it was basic maybe a lil over salted. I will probably try again but only because it's so close and who knows, they may do another dish better
column340: Casa Patron has quickly become my go to place for enchiladas in Seattle. I typically order the enchilada combo which comes with 2 enchiladas, rice, and refried beans. Simply delicious. I usually get 1 chicken and 1 picadillo (shredded beef) with the red sauce. It comes with a generous amount of cheese on top as well. I usually avoid getting shredded meat because I typically find it to be stringy or dried. This is not the case for these enchiladas! It not only feeds your belly, it feeds your soul. Enjoy!
column341:
Casa Patron seems like a neighborhood mexican joint frequented by locals, but isn't anything special, just another mediocre restaurant. The only thing going for them is that they're open late.

The restaurant is huge, with a lower section with a bar, and a large upper dining section. It's decorated like a traditional family mexican restaurant. A very colorful decor with a cultural ambiance. 

I tried a mezcal margarita, and that was really amazing.
However, the food leaves a lot to be desired. We found everything we had lacking in general flavor, and low quality. Starting from the chips and salsa, the salsa was runny. We tried an enchilada and veggie fajitas, and the enchilada sauce was very runny and slightly bitter, while the fajita was mostly squash and carrots, with a sprinkle of peppers. Even the rice and beans weren't good.

The service is how you'd expect in a cultural setting. The servers were in general very friendly and prompt, but there was some confusion and we had three servers asking the same things. Not a big deal IMO.

Overall, the restaurant is very okay-ish. Not a place to go to when there are plenty of options nearby, but an option for late night eats.
column342:
I had the shrimp enchiladas for dinner a few days ago and it was sooooooo delicious!  If you need a Mexican cuisine fix, Casa Patron is the place to go!  I also loved their chips and salsa, nice and spicy sauce.
I will be reordering this shrimp enchilada with the rice and beans this weekend....FOR SURE!!  Who wants to cook when Casa Patron is a few blocks away!
column343: It was a good environment and okay food, the service was very nice and friendly, would definitely drop by on the weekend
column344: Service can be a  bit slow sometimes but the food is really good. I've ordered something different every time I've been since there are so many options
column345: This has become one of our favorite places for Mexican food and of course margaritas.  The first time we visited we had the pork chop dinner served with black beans and fluffy rice and chile relleno.  It was so delicious. We also ordered a top-shelf margarita which I should advise you only need one.  For dessert we ordered the flan which was nice and creamy just like it should be.  The second time we visited we sat at the bar and ordered a la carte cheese enchilada and taco al pastor along with a mezcal Margarita.  All were delicious, we were not disappointed. The ambiance is like a Spanish villa and the music is traditional Spanish music.  I can't wait to visit on a Saturday because they have Mariachis.  I gave a 4 star rating only because the bartender tends to ignore us and we have to get his attention but this will not deter us from coming back.
column346: I love the atmosphere here! It's always cheerful and festive. The staff is incredible - so friendly and upbeat. It's a tad pricey but the food and drinks are delicious. The guava margarita and mojito are great but order the plum rita!
column347: My husband really wants me to like this place so I gave it another try and this time he asked me to try their Cuban sandwich .  I dare you putting bacon in this sandwich and forgetting about Mayo, mustard and pickles. So disappointing.
column348: This has become our fav go to spot in the area! It's not huge and pretty low key. The servers are awesome and the food is amazing!! We come here once a month now and are happy everytime. We normally get the arroz con pollo and arroz con camarones, because it's cheesy,  tomatoe-y, and not spicy mmm. Recently I got the spinach enchiladas and OMG the spinach and red sauce combination was everything I could ask for as a vegetarian! Love this place! They also have free chips, salsa, and pico de gallo. (Little spicy)
column349: Great tacos for a good price, super quick and served hot so it doesn't need reheating at home.
column350: Fast and friendly service, cheap prices. You can get a big burrito for ~$8.50. Best for a breakfast burrito on the weekend or a quick lunch during the workday. The food  quality can be a little hit or miss depending on what or when you order, but overall it hits the spot when you want to crush a quick burrito.
column351: Cheap and hits the spot in an area with few options. I paid $4.50 for a fish taco and carne asada, with free pickled veggies and salsas. The fish taco was in breaded and well flavored and the combo of the tomatoes and sauce made it really well balanced. The carne asada was pleasant but a little dry. Nothing to write home about but I will be back for the fish tacos. Right off the side of Lake City Way.
column352: Always the best truck in the area. Great portions and friendly service. I know a lot of randoms give negative reviews to places like Monarca, but I have lived in the neighborhood for four years and give them the highest marks. This is a five star food truck offering!
column353: I thought I'd already reviewed this awesome taco truck. Whoops! I love their food, especially the Mulita. So delicious with the avocado and especially with the Adobada (marinated pork). I wish their regular salsas were spicier, but their special chipotle sauce is fantastic and has a good kick. Free pickled jalapeños, carrots, and onions. Breakfast menu. Open 9:30am-9pm. Grab a 6-pack from the adjacent Shell station to go with your platter of tacos. They even have fish tacos and camarones and tamarind soda. AND you can call your order in advance, so no waiting outside when it's cold. What more could you ask for?
column354: Food truck (not the nicest looking) parked in a shell gas station parking lot. Do not let that deceive you. They make good tacos. They give good portions and they are tasty. I had the pollo, adobada, carnitas, cabeza y lengua. My preference to order from here will be in this order: lengua, cabeza y pollo. But to each their own. They speak English and Spanish and are friendly. Their green salsa is better than their red. The red is thicker and has a little kick. Thought I'd warn you faint of heart ppl haha. Tacos are $2 and up. They also make burritos and full plate entrees. Enjoy.
column355: Workers are friendly and conveniently located near my apartment. They were able to accommodate my need for no dairy without any hesitation. My new go to spot ! Delicious.
column356: Amazing taco truck! The adobada and cabeza were incredible. Fast and friendly service and lots of options in their menu. Great find. Would recommend!
column357: Im done w this place.  I have been coming to this truck for over 4 yrs.  Sometimes it is ok, more often than not it sucks.  Their burritos are 90% dry, crispy rice and boring whole pinto beans.  Add dry, tooth chipping scraps of charred beef and you have a big $9 pile of garbage.  I will miss their escabeche and their salsa verde, which is pretty spicy.  I wont miss the inconsistant nature of their food, their lack of avocado, or that feeling i get when i bite into a pile of garbage wrapped in a tortilla.  Shame on you, Im willing to bet NONE of you eat what you serve.  Atleast my DOG is happy.
column358:
Stopped by to get some tacos on the way home. I got the adobada (marinated pork), carne asada (steak), & lengua (tongue) for ~$5. I ate the adobada and carne asada first, with just a squeeze of lime and found them to be quite lean and salty rather than flavorful.  I started adding the green (smoky & slightly spicy) and the red (mild & fresh) salsas, which helped make the tacos much more enjoyable and flavorably balanced. I had learned my lesson for the lengua taco and generously topped it with the remaining salsas & lime - altogether it was my favorite taco of the trio. 

TLDR: Decent tacos. Add salsa(s) when eating
column359: I used to come here a lot but the last couple of times there was a guy running the truck and things seemed off.  Last time I went I ordered a carnitas burrito to find no meat inside. I called and he offered to refund my money but I just don't want to deal with inconsistency so I will go to Loxicha Oaxacan food truck on 15th.
column360:
Is a cheap place and I thank that, however, the employees seems to hate you and hate life :/
Also the meat was kind dry... so im not going there anymore
column361: Delicious food - got takeout for a large group last night and everyone finished it before we knew it! Their tacos are out of this world - the pork and chicken are delicious, but the steak is out of this world. Nice people, amazing food cooked right in front of you. Such a find!!! Tip: eat it right there, hot off the grill.
column362: Tasty and authentic Mexican food at great prices prepared very quickly by a friendly staff. The chicken tacos al pastor are ridiculously good.
column363:
For this place to drop from a 5 to a 3 is really, REALLY saying something, and I don't take this lightly. When I write that we spent 3 months grabbing lunch or dinner here twice a week, and it decreased to the point of taking a break for a full month. I write it with an indescribable sadness. This WAS our go-to taco truck, and I was so excited to announce that on Yelp, but this update needs to be written.

The food used to be prepared with love, but with a new face something has changed for the worst. The food, which used to take 10-15 minutes to put together now seems to take 5-7, and that usually isn't a good sign. It's obvious biting into the food that the quality and freshness has suffered a hit. 

I tried it again just last night and it was prepared by a tall man with a hair net. My heart sank, because he's cooked my food before and it's disappointed me anytime. ANYWAY, the taco meat was WATERY. You ever had watery taco meat before? Me either.

Gross.
column364:
You've messed up my order for the last time! The burrito was terrible today and not made to order. Got my $10 back and won't be returning.

The food quality has always varied and only been moderate at best. 

They charge $5 per mulitas while most other places charge $5 for 2.

The convenience of walking here isn't worth it.
column365:
Let me get this out of the way- I love Mexican food more than I love people, pets, and maybe even freedom and eagles. I thought the burritos at the Taqueria up on 196th in Lynnwood were the gold standard(and I've had enough burritos to justify being about 300 pounds heavier than I am). In fact, I was fully prepared to offer my hand in marriage to the man who made those burritos in spite of being staunchly heterosexual. This was before I went to Monarca Express.

Yes, I live FAIRLY close to this truck. Why did it take me almost a year to go here? Why did I go to the truck in Northgate? The answer, citizens of Yelp, is because I'm a sorry excuse for a human being. Consider this review a personal apology to the angel in the form of a slightly below average height Mexican man who mans this truck. The menu is not wildly different from what you might find at any other taco truck(though they offer a Chorizo burrito and don't offer tamales), but the meat....the meat.....it's the key. The way they spice it and bless it with enough flavor to hype up Public Enemy in the 1980's pretty much leaves me with an overwhelming desire to go here every day. 

This place is not the recipient of review inflation- it is that good. It's good enough to go to Lake City, and those are not words I utter or write easily.
column366:
Done Hoping For improvement.
Prices higher portions smaller quality poorer.
Went in tonight and when I got home my Mexican plate was the smallest I've ever received..
column367: I ordered from door dash and it said tacos $6.00, being taco(s) if figured more than 1 at least 2 especially at $6.00. well I was wrong, so I got 2, (cause I ordered 2 orders) little street tacos for $12.00!! Plus the fee for door dash I paid a total of $18.01 for 2 little street tacos.
column368: Really enjoy visiting this food truck regularly, especially for the Adobada Pork Tacos!
column369:
Full disclosure: I have been relying on delivery services for food during this social distancing period so this review is solely for food that arrived, not a dine-in experience. 

Ordered: a pair of chicken tamales with beans and rice, plus a taco salad in a shell with minced beef. 

The tamales were good but the sauce was a little bland. The beans and rice were just fine. The salad was topped with beef, shredded Monterrey Jack cheese, pico de gallo, guacamole, and sour cream. 
 
I don't think I'd order from them again. For the price, the food was just okay.
column370: Tortilla soup heaven!! This place has the best food and the friendliest staff! Sad to see it so empty during covid, we love it and will continue to support them as much as we can!
column371: Ordered six lengua tacos and costed $25. Pretty pricey huh? Not only that but the lengua was super dry. The tortilla was drier than the meat and kept falling apart. It was totally not edible. A waste of $25 that I could have invested in another restaurant.
column372:
Still not so bueno. There really aren't many good options while walking around Greenlake, and for whatever reason, people default to Mexican -- since it's usually not bad. But, while on the last visit, the burrito "passed" and on my first visit my tacos were edible, on this visit my tortilla soup was terrible. It was so oversalted I had to add about a bowl's worth of pico to make it edible -- and I told the waitress when she asked. I'll admit I didn't say, "Please give me something else." But, I did say, "This is so incredibly salty I am having a hard time eating it." And, she said, "Sorry." And, then walked away. So, eek! Bad food this visit, pretty weak food the last two times, and nice but insufficient customer service (but yes, I'm signing up for a course in assertive clarity in just one moment...). 

Bottom line: Go to Greenlake to walk. Then leave.
column373: This restaurant is really well located-you can go to it right off of Greenlake. The staff is really nice, and they have good serving sizes. I would give them 3/5 stars because their bathroom needs to be more accessible and secure (there was an issue with the lock). The food is okay-while they have good quality of food, they don't have the most unique options. The staff is what makes this place worth coming to, but they do need to make a few changes.
column374:
Came here for drinks with a friend - service was slow even though the place was not full. I ordered La Mula ("mezcal" mule) and my friend ordered a blended strawberry margarita. They got our drink orders, took them a while to get them for us, once they did come and leave the drinks I took a sip of my drink and saw there was a bug, waited for the waitress to come back... waited... waited more... finally had to stand up to flag her down after 20-30 mins. Told her her my drink had a big and she proceeded to question weather it has just fallen in there... when the drink was full and obviously had not taken more than a sip.. (trust me it would have been done in 30 mins). Brought me a second drink and it tasted like ginger beer.. no mezcal. I asked the waitress to make sure I had ordered the right one. And she responded with, I don't know what they put in drinks, I wouldn't be able to tell you. 

My friends drink also tasted like a strawberry juice. 

Should of left but tried a different drink, a mezcal margarita, same thing - no mezcal ‍

When the bill came they didn't even have the courtesy of discounting the first drink that has a big in it. 

I'm definitely not going there again.
column375:
I have always liked this place! Good food and food service and amazing amazing chips and salsa! 

Too bad they stopped taking Groupons for some legal reason the waiter said...just an FYI
column376:
This would be the few rare occasions that I run into mediocre Mexican food, I really didn't think you can go wrong with Mexican food, everything is suppose to taste decent if it's smothered in guacamole, salsa, or sour cream. Mexican food is the only food I think still taste delicious the next day as leftovers, heck I even think Taco Time is amazing. I think this place is has a selling point being right on Green Lake and is open late until 1:30am with their kitchen still serving food until midnight.  

The chips and salsa was about the best thing I tasted all night, all the rest of it food were really soggy with grease dripping everywhere making it impossible for me to hold anything to eat without my arm getting drown in oil. I was excited for my deep fried chicken taquitos that consistently taste great every where, the chicken tasted really off here. Overall, I should have save my money and went to the late night Taco Bell drive thru although it's not "authentic" Mexican food, at least they give me hot sauce with life quotes on it.

I still give this place a 3 star because service was nice and if this is your only option late at night living near here, then let it be. 

Tell me about your experience if you've been here or is going to after reading this review:)
column377:
As a local whose lived in Greenlake my entire life, I've been here countless times. I used to really like it but after this last experience, I will never support this business or any related business. 

I made a simple takeout order, an order I've placed dozens of times, with intentions of using a coupon. The coupon specifically detailed it wasn't valid during happy hour or in combination with any other discounts- that's it, nothing about take out. They wouldn't accept the coupon, and wouldn't give an explanation. Frustrating but there was unfortunately more. 

Then, of course after paying, I realized an additional item that I did not order yet had been charged for. Still in the restaurant, I politely told the waitress that there had been a mistake, to which I was informed that in fact it was my fault. They refused correct the error. I have never heard of the dish I apparently ordered in my life. Not only was staff was extremely rude but they repeatedly blamed the customer. 

Luckily, Greenlake has many great options for dining, and there's no reason anyone should put up with this conduct. If you're looking for good Mexican food in Greenlake, Rositas is a great choice.
column378:
I haven't been to Tacos Guaymas for about two years. I'm giving two stars as both the service and the food were sub-par. It took 15minutes for our waiter to take our drinks order. And then another 20 minutes to get our drinks. We both ordered fajitas and the plate with the beans, sour cream, guacamole etc were brought to the table first. The food was already barely warm. About 10 minutes later the meat finally arrived. And the food wasn't very good at all. 

The restaurant wasn't crowded so I'm not sure why service was so slow.
column379:
Don't know why they have 3 stars... I'm just here to
say... their Nachos Machos rules!
column380:
Very average Mexican food. I got the wet burrito w/ carne asada and it was decent. I wasn't a fan of the sauce they covered the burrito with.. it tasted like can enchilada sauce. My friends tried the flautas and fish tacos and they said it was okay. The meal did however come with complimentary chips and salsa

Basically if you are looking for cheaper Mexican food around Greenlake this does the trick.
column381:
Great tacos and customer service. Probably the better chorizo tacos I've tasted in the area.  Open late on the weekends. 

Last night left a bag while eating. Called when I got home and they kept out for me to pick up the next day.
column382: Ordered a pick up through Yelp and it was super timely, the food was fresh and really convenient. Thanks!
column383: They are conveniently located next to Greenlake.  Love their outdoor seating area on nice days.  They also have large windows so even if you're sitting inside you can still enjoy the sunshine and activities going on outside.  I recommend the chimichanga! Large portions and definitely share-able.  They have complimentary chips and salsa when you sit down.  We went for brunch and had $5 mimosas.  The service is good, no complaints.  The food came out hot and the wait wasn't too long.  I definitely recommend if you're in the area and craving Mexican food.
column384: I ordered 3 Super Burrito's and they were the driest worst burritos I have ever had. We could only taste the tomatoes in it and there was no steak flavor. They didn't include salsa. I have never ordered from a taqueria and not received salsa. I will never order from them again.
column385:
When it's good, it's good! When it's bad, it's not worth the time or money. Last night was the latter. 

We were seated at just after 7 and didn't settle our bill until after 9, and we didn't linger because it had gotten uncomfortably chilly by 9. We requested several tables be pushed together to accommodate two families with kids. They did half the work and we ultimately had to add the last table. The first round of drinks took 20+ minutes - no joke - to come out and the Corona Light was delivered first on draft. Several minutes later the margaritas came out. Oddly, the next Corona Light was in a bottle. The place was 1/3 full of people. They clearly have staffing issues, as evidenced by the sign on the window looking for prep chefs and servers. Our friends at the next table told us to cancel our order and go elsewhere while we still could after reporting their food took over an hour, came out in waves, and had several mistakes. We were foolish enough not to heed their warning and suffered the same fate. We told our server we were going to cancel our order and she said it's already cooking. That was 50 minutes before it came out. This is Mexican food. Does it EVER take that long? 

Long story short, food was the same "just okay" quality, took forever to come out, and we were offered nothing more than a sorry from our kind server. 

Adios, Tacos Guaymas. Sad to say goodbye but totally done spending too much on another bad dining experience.
column386:
So I've been back countless times since last review & have neglected to update. 

Still a solid 3 stars. Layout & small space of restaurant leaves something to be desired. Service pretty good. Not the best Mexican food in Seattle but will do in a pinch. 

Had the HH Taquitos on my last visit. Good tasting but not much chicken inside & kinda dry. On my last visit I had the HH chicken taco salad & it was excellent.
column387: Favorite spot for food and drinks in Green Lake! 3 sections- quick to go, sit down, and bar. Bar has tv's for games. Always great music. Staff are lovely and food is delicious. Great drinks too. Highly recommend you check out our go-top spot
column388: My husband LOVES their wet chicken verde burrito; it's healthier than most burritos, with lots of chicken, just the right amount of beans, rice and delicious sauce. I pick one up for him weekly! Their happy hour menu is the perfect size and price for tasting, and their bar/wait staff is very friendly, attentive and accommodating. Highly recommended. A must-do stop for meeting up with friends or taking food home to go after your Green Lake workout or adventure.
column389: This place has fantastic food. I look forward to the end of "Covid Season" when we'll be able to dine in once again. Ordering for take out is working well, and as always the food is fresh and based on local ingredients. No regrets! Yummy!
column390:
I hardly ever eat fast food...like 5 times a year or less.
When I say fast food, I'm only considering the major chains like McDonald's, B King, Taco Bell, Pop Eyes and yes, Taco Time.

We randomly stopped in here a week or so ago and were pleasantly surprised all around!

The staff was so friendly and helpful! I was so indecisive but they were kind and very patient.

We ordered to eat there and the food came out plated all nice. I didn't know that's how Taco Time rolled lol it was a nice touch. It felt less like a fast food chain.

The food was "fresh fresh" and we left satisfied all around. When we need that quick fix again, we'll be back!
column391:
This location is a safety hazard to all of Seattle.  Leaving the drive thru and trying to turn right is extremely dangerous.  The owners need to address this immediately.  I have been a loyal taco time customer since I was a little kid.  The lake city location has already lost my business for their lack of hygiene (I'm talking filthy disgusting trash all over the floor environment).  Anyways, if I don't see no parking signs displayed along 45th within the next two weeks I will be filing a complaint with the city of Seattle.  And most importantly you will have lost my business. 

3/24/2020 update: looks like covid-19 took care of the parking situation.
column392:
I wish I went here more often. I like the food. I appreciate the quality.I see young, new staff from time to time.
I am always impressed re cleanliness and quickness to make food.
I am going to comment re parking and leaving from the drive-thru. It is a little hard to turn right as sometimes cars do block vision. It is impossible and completely reckless to try to turn left.
We live in Seattle and we have to think when we drive.
column393: All of the Taco Bell Lovers out there don't know what they are missing! Apparently Taco Time is just a Washington thing. There aren't that many of them and now that I don't live in Washington I rarely get to eat there. But when I come back for a visit I look forward to my Crispy Beef Burrito! Yum! And Mexifries! Dipped in Hot Sauce! Oh man, now I'm hungry again! Seriously though Taco Time is really good. I love that the burrito is actually crispy - fried yummy goodness! Next time you are in Washington State find a Taco Time and see what you've been missing!
column394:
We found this place on our recent trip to Seattle. It reminds us of a fast food taco place here in Southern CA, only better. They have a lot of options and each item we tried was tasty. The refried bean crisp burrito and the crisp chicken taco lite were delicious. But, we really loved their Crustos. Fried tortilla with cinnamon and sugar. We couldn't eat them fast enough. 
It was convenient and we got our order quickly. Hit the spot while we were driving around sightseeing.
column395:
have you ever tried taking a left turn out of the drive-through???
Or taking a right turn out of the drive through? 
and can't see a god damn thing. almost killing yourself to go to this damn taco time
column396: I wish Taco Time was less expensive. I've never understood why their prices are so high for being fast food? But we still go here and love it! I get the natural tacos on the whole wheat tortilla and get the ranch sauce on the side or it's super saucy and messy! Natural beef, chicken, and natural veggie tacos are all super good! I've also ordered the chicken fit bowl and that it super flavorful too and healthy! Always splurge on the mexi fries!!!!!! So worth it!!!
column397: Well Taco Time, I've tried to like you over the years but I just can't do it anymore.  Not when my #1 meal with beef comes to over $12 which involves a burrito that basically fits in the palm of my hand.  I finished it in 6 regular sized bites!  I left still feeling hungry and unsatisfied.  Other burrito joints in the area serve up a burrito that I can't even finish in 1 sitting, far superior at a cheaper price!  Until I hear it's changed, and you get what you pay for, I'm done with you.  Either reduce the price or increase the portions, dramatically!
column398:
I get it, it's fast food. I'm not expecting authentic Mexican nor am I even expecting Tex-Mex but I still have standards for this level of food.

The pros are that most of the ingredients were fresh for our visit. Also, the food seems a lot less processed than other fast food taco spots. Finally, I like the eco-friendly angle the franchise takes.

The cons are that the food was a mixed bag of flavorful and bland. Some of the items we ordered had bits of citrus, salt, and fat, what you expect of this cuisine. However, the overall experience felt as though we were eating at a place trying to save cost or cut calories by choosing the less tasty options.

We've tried it once, maybe we'll try another location if we're in a pinch for time but I can't say that it'll be our first choice.
column399:
In a word: NASTY!  We started to come through the back door, which is the kitchen, and it is filthy.  The front door and windows were greasy and dirty.
We ordered a combo shrimp meal and a combo taco meal.  Could not eat the shrimp tacos as they were disgusting (measly quantity of cabbage and way overcooked shrimp - see photo).  Beef tacos had absolutely no flavor as they "forgot to put the sauce on them".  The potato tots were cold, the soda was flat and the iced tea tasted like chemicals.  The only positive in the whole experience was the cashier who was friendly.  When we asked for a side order of chips, we were told it would be 69 cents for 8 chips.  They count the chips??? Since we couldn't eat the food there, we went to Kidd Valley and had fish and chips which were excellent!
column400:
Okay gonna keep it 3 star because I was happy with response from Taco Time management about my problem. Had they not replied I would have knocked them down to 2. 

So....  I very rarely go to Taco Time. I do like their food quite a bit as does hubby. But the value for food received always leaves me sad.  

This most recent visit I went through the drive thru to pick up a taco salad for myself and 2 tacos for hubby. One crunchy & one Baja.  Taco salad great, crispy taco great but Baja taco practically inedible. The tortilla was completely broken apart.  No way to pick it up and eat it as a taco.  I don't know if it was an old tortilla or just poor tortilla choice to make a soft taco with. I contacted Taco Time and offered to send a pic of taco. They replied that they would send me a gift card for a free menu item to make up for bad taco.
column401: Just left Taco Time's drive through. The guy who helped me was not wearing a mask. The food is always good there, but safety is very important right now. I will not be back.
column402:
I really wish I could like Taco Time.  It's local, always spotless inside, and the people are friendly.  But the food is just not good.  I've had several things on the menu.  The crisp tacos and natural soft tacos are fine, if no better than ok.  But today I tried the crisp burrito because the counter guy suggested it would be like a chimichanga.  It's not. And it was bad; dry and flavorless.
I also had chips and salsa.  Chips were flavorless and needed salt; fine, I can add salt.  But the medium salsa was awful. Bland and sweet, like tomato sauce with some honey stirred in.  No garlic, no onion, no chiles, no flavor.  No thanks.
I can't do it.  I've had my last meal at Taco Time.
column403: Got a chicken soft taco and mexi fries. My order came out EXTREMELY quickly, v impressive. Food was tasty as always and the restaurant was sleepy in the afternoon but clean. Love the architecture of this unique taco time!
column404: Probably 50% higher prices than other Taco Times in the city.  Also filthy throughout.  Food tasted fine and was quick.  People were fine too.
column405: Dining room was dirty, tables look like they had not been wiped all day, trash was full, bathrooms were disgusting and to top it all off the food was very poorly prepared. The beef was completely burnt and the tacos barely had any cheese on them. You would think during the middle of a state declared emergency for corona virus outbreak there would be more sanitation attempts. I don't have any experience in restaurant management and I'm pretty certain I could do a better job.
column406:
I've been to this Taco Time about once per week for the past 7 years.  In the Wallingford district of Seattle there are a great many place to eat but this is one of my favorites.  It's not cute little hipster place but it has everything I like.  It's clean, convenient, healthy, inexpensive, fast, and tasty.

The staff knows be by sight and they are always cheerful and even wave to me when I come in.  There's off-street parking available although it can be a little tricky getting out of their parking lot as you share the same exit with the drive-through.

I highly recommend this higher-quality fast food restaurant in Seattle.
column407:
When you're expecting Taco Bell, and you get Taco Time, it's just disappointing. I'm going to compare it to Taco Bell because that's what I was expecting if the place is called Taco Time :)

This is in reference to the soft beef burrito I had: In comparison to TB, TT is significantly more expensive and doesn't taste as good (and by good, I mean cheap-cheesy-satisfying-late-night-Americanized-Mexican-food-good :) I also had the fish burrito, and that was decent and not something you could find at TB.

On the plus side, the portions are bigger, and the hot sauce is pretty good.

Objectively, it's not THAT bad, but it's in that strange in between state of not quite Taco Bell, and definitely not authentic Mexican.

I won't be frequenting TT, but if I had it for free, I wouldn't be complaining :)
column408: I went on a pleasant spring evening and there were some loud teens sitting in the back of a pickup truck parked outside drinking sodas and telling loud stories which I bet where more appropriate for a private setting but besides that the futuristic architecture makes me feel like a science fiction movie and the crisp bean burrito was one of the best ones I've had in 30 years of eating crisp bean burritos. there are some nice neon murals inside, but be warned: the jalapenos here were hotter than other locations.
column409:
A solid Mexican spot located right by Green Lake Park -- it was super easy to order online and I walked to the lakefront to eat my food. The staff was nice and the food was tasty too! They're doing indoor seating as well, but I just got takeout. They also have a ton of vegetarian options, which is great. 

I got the cheese enchiladas peqeños with verde salsa and it was the perfect amount of food -- the enchilada was super tasty and the rice was also fluffy and good. I really loved the chili verde flavor and the refried beans were also good with the chips they gave us!
column410:
Great takeout from Rosita's tonight!! Highly recommend. I was so impressed, not only with the food but the entire takeout experience. They were easy to order via phone, they have a takeout window setup now, and best of all the food was perfectly boxed up and in a sealed to go bag--never seen these before but it definitely keeps the food fresh! 
I loved their fajitas when we've dined there in the past and I was craving them, I can honestly say they were very close to as good to go. Of course nothing beats fresh fajitas sizzling on a plate, but that's just not possible during COVID. Rosita's has done a phenomenal job! Good portion sizes too. We'll be back!
column411: I love Rosita's! I've been going here for the past three years and every time it is great. I ordered online through ChowNow (link to order is on Rosita's website) for pickup. The restaurant has a pickup window open so nobody enters the restaurant, which is awesome! My food was ready within 15 minutes of placing the order and it was packaged well and stayed warm in the new takeout bags (which are sealed closed to be ripped open at home). Really happy with the precautions being taken here, and glad that the restaurant is able to adapt so well. I'll definitely be ordering takeout here again in the near future!
column412:
I've always wanted to try this restaurant out after walking around the lake. This restaurant is like any typical Mexican restaurant with higher than average prices. They have all the typical dishes at any Mexican restaurants and the decor is rather pretty nice. It's kind bigger than I thought too. 

I ordered a soup since I didn't want to fill all the way up and wanted some dessert next door. I ordered their sopa de frijoles and it has really good flavors. It didn't look super appetizing since it looked like it has just black soup. There are also rice, tomatoes, onions, and cilantro. I wish it had more rice since it felt it had a lot of black beans than other ingredients. The flavor was good though.
column413:
Really good hand made corn tortilla.
Good service and quality food.
Haven't tried any drinks but offers and has a good atmosphere for families to the singles.
Parking requires some patience but,
Would come back!
column414: Love this Greenlake local and family-owned restaurant! The food is great and the staff and efficient and very nice. I especially like to order the chimichangas every time. It's a favorite.
column415: Great Mexican food! I love ordering the enchiladas. The beans and rice are a perfect side. Their chips are my fav with the guacamole.
column416: I live supporting this local business. Rosita's has amazing food and their to go game is strong. Our dinner was ready within 20 minutes, super easy pick up process, and they seal the to go bag so the nachos were crisp and fresh.
column417: I miss coming to Rosita. We haven't gone since the pandemic started but this place is great -- great food and great proportions. Feels very much like home cooking!
column418:
Rositas is my go-to neighborhood restaurant when I'm craving a good Mexican dish. They have a great vegetarian menu and the coconut margaritas are delicious! The happy hour menu has great options but only can be ordered in the bar so if you have kids or the bar is full you're out of luck. 

The fresh tortilla bar is such a great idea and fun for kids to get to watch the tortillas being made. Bring cash for tipping and you can eat endless amounts of tortillas while you wait for your food. The salsa is really tasty.
