I also understand that the mood is divey here, and the "harsh" treatment from the servers is part of its "charm," but I wasn't impressed, and likely won't be back nor will I recommend Beth's Cafe.
column2388:
On my first ever visit to Seattle for Emerald City Comic Con 2019 and to hang out with on of my best friends from college, he raved that we MUST grab an omelette from this small diner, and boy, he was right!

Him and I came on a Saturday morning around 10:00am and saw there was a small line outside the door of people waiting to get a table.  Now, I will say that the parking is very minimal and tight here.  We ended up parking in the tight parking lot at the rear of the restaurant, so we were lucky.  He put our names on the list and there was about a 20-30 minute wait, which we were fine with.  I thought it was cool how there is writing and hand-drawn art on all of the walls and ceilings here, definitely put off a hipster-ish, Seattle vibe to me.  The staff here were pretty friendly too.

So when I looked at the menu, immediately I knew I had to try one of their omelettes, as the smallest, is six eggs (I've never seen or eaten an omelette that big)!!  If you're feeling extra daring, you could order a twelve egg omelette (and be in an egg-induced food coma the rest of the day).  As for me, I enjoyed a couple cups of coffee and ordered their six egg "The Veggie" omelette and added bacon (because you can't have enough protein!).

It didn't take very long for my buddy and I's omelettes to come out.  For being such a big omelette though, it tasted incredible!  I put some hot sauce on top and went to town.  I loved the fact too that it with each bite, I got egg, veggies, bacon, and hash browns as it was placed on a bed of them.  I ate the whole thing and swept up all of the leftovers that fell out with the slices of whole wheat toast.

I had a great first experience at Beth's Cafe though and find myself dreaming of getting another six egg omelette every morning now!
column2389:
Giving it a 4 stars because I have never enjoyed an experience so much where I've regretted every moment of it. As I was eating, I had several questions. Why am I here? What decisions led me to this place? What would my younger self think if he saw me eating this? That being said, still an enjoyable experience.

We went to Beth's at 2 in the morning to get the True Beth's Experience™. The drawings inside were super cute, there was one room that was literally only Pokemon which was really cool! It's endearing to see so many people express themselves here, and to me it's a nice form of community.

This place is known for their 12 egg omelette, so of course I was going to get one. But I would be an idiot if I thought I could finish this on my own. So, I split one with a friend. We did the logical thing and chose the one we thought was the one that was best for us, so we obviously chose the Triple Bypass. This omelette has breakfast sausage, bacon, diced ham, and American and Swiss cheese. On top of this was a large serving of hash browns that were also bottomless. This thing was massive. Like, I think it was served on a pizza tray.

I'll be honest, I think that if you get the omelette and rate this lower than a 4, you're taking this place too seriously. That being said, yeah, the omelette was good. The eggs were cooked all the way through, and it was super meaty and cheesy. I will say that the American cheese was an overwhelming taste, and it was super heavy. I was struggling to finish the omelette and I needed hot sauce and ketchup to finish my half. And while the omelette tasted good, I felt like garbage with every bite after about 2 minutes. The hash browns were also really crispy and went well with the heavy and soft omelette. That being said, lots of fun! We finished after about 15 minutes and I regretted everything.

It is worth mentioning that we did get an extra plate charge with the omelette because we split, which kind of sucks. The service was also not the best, but do I really care given that it was 2am? Not really.

I'm never coming here again. There is no reason for me to come here again after experiencing the 12 egg omelette. It was a pilgrimage that was memorable and extremely fun but one that I would never do. I went on a run the next morning and felt like trash. Thanks Beth!
column2390:
This place is outstanding!

The amount of food you get is insane, and the quality of it is even better. It's a little sticky, but that's to be expected from a long standing breakfast joint. 

If you're in Seattle you have to try this place out. Rain or shine the wait is worth it!
column2391:
It really feels like a small-town diner. There's booths like you'd see in the movies and for their wall decorations, it's all hand-drawn pages taped to their walls with masking tape. It's not bad, just not a high-end kind of place, but it makes you think more about time with friends and living in the moment. 

Their food is like any diner food. I didn't think it was that special. My group ordered a 12-egg-omelette called the "triple bypass" or something, and it was piled high. I had like a pancake plate and spilt the farmer's omelete (6 eggs).  The portion size there is kind of insane. And hash browns are unlimited?? 

It's definitely an experience, but I don't think I could go again. It's a heavy meal.
column2392: DO NOT ORDER. im trying to get them blacklisted. This place is f***ing awful. We tried to order from them twice and both orders got cancelled. When I tried to call this terrible sounding woman answered "what?!" And them immediately hung up. I then tried to call again with an answer of "Whit's End?!" And when i tried to explain to them what had happened she started attacking me as a customer and not the delivery service. I don't know if she was drunk or what but it was belligerent, rude, and she was cussing at a customer which even for a bartender is f***ing low.  I received no information on how we could get food from them. They said they were temporarily closed even though someone answered the phone?! If you go here only get drinks and leave.
column2393:
Even though Inslee said stay home the Whit is still open for full service business. Thanks! I couldn't imagine making my own food or even grabbing a beer from my own fridge. 
Keep up the great service. Here's to supporting locals in this pandemic crisis.
column2394:
A small, dive bar with street parking.

However - they have a great, varied selection of local beers. Additionally, a few games, pool, etc. We came for Wednesday Night Raclette and it was great! they do serve food but food served with cheese is that much better.
column2395:
Came in here a few weeks back while I was in town for my friends' wedding weekend. We were all staying in AirBNBs around Phinney and Green Lake and wandered into this spot because it was empty and had enough seating for all of us. What a mistake that was.

Judging by their couple Yelp photos criticizing Yelp, I'm guessing these guys don't understand how social media and online reviews work. We had come from a couple bars in Green Wood that had a ton of craft beer and great cocktails, to find that this place had boring cocktails and only a few mediocre craft beers on tap. To insult us even more, the bartender whom we think may have been one of the owners, ignored our group for nearly five minutes while he was yelling at someone on the phone.

When he eventually got to us, he had this attitude to him that didn't reflect all the nice things people say about Seattle culture. One by one we ordered our drinks (and some of us ordered food) and the bartender seemingly treated us with irreverence. 

The food we ordered turned out to be the only bright spot of the night, but customer service and a smile on your face go a long way. This place could use a lesson in hospitality training before I recommend any of my friends to go here. Go check out Cozy Nut or Prost nearby instead.
column2396: All I can say about this place is...it's awesome. The owner has the same haircut as me, the beer is cold, friendly staff, great food, prices are well below Seattle regular. And they have full bar, pool, and golden tee. Think I found my new local spot
column2397: I loved In The Red, and I love The Whit's End just as much. The more playful pub-like atmosphere is engaging without trading off the impeccable wine selection as most local watering holes do. I'm still surprised and delighted by the wine selection and recommendations. But now I can have my beer and cocktail drinking buddies hang and play pinball.
column2398: Found this place recently and absolutely love it. I can only hope that I don't wind up wearing out my welcome. Great crowd, great vibe, upbeat. Just plain fun. I should mention that they're open for World Cup games even though I'm not much of a soccer fan. Chad's a fantastic host and good company.
column2399: Amazing restaurant. I suggest that everyone go here. Went there the other night with my friends amazing cocktails amazing food just overall excellent atmosphere. Cannot stress again how much I believe people should be bringing their friends here.
column2400:
Looks like some of the below reviews were positive but gave one star. Not sure what that's about.

In any event, Phinney Ridge is frightfully thin on good down-to-earth bars where you can just watch a game and throw darts, particularly after Ed's closed. This place totally fits the bill. Friendly people, good tap list, great spot.
column2401: Very cool, neighborhood bar. Check this place out. Cheap drinks, good food. Do yourself a favor.
column2402: Such a great place! Open for all the World Cup matches, even 7am kickoffs! Made a special breakfast menu with breakfast burrito and tots, simultaneous matches on, and of course amazing service! Would come back for sure!
column2403: stopped by on a Friday night and this place has a ton of selections for beer on tap. We had a already eaten, but will definitely be back. Lots of games (pool, pinball, darts, etc) if that's your jam.
column2404: If you are looking for a casual, neighborhood bar..........this is it!   Chad is usually bartending and is a fountain of knowledge.  There is a TV ideally set for watching sports, as well as tables and outdoor seating that is great on these warm Seattle nights!  Marc is in charge of the food, and is delicious pub fare!   Do drop in!!!!    You will surely enjoy it!!
column2405: The steak frites here are SO GOOD. One of my first take out meals since quarantine, and it did not disappoint.
column2406: I went here a few times before quarantine started and always liked it. It's the only place in Seattle I found where I could get escargot (I think it's the first time I had it) and it was really good, not just a thing I ate so I could say I tried it  but something I went back for again. Sandwiches and things were also pretty good. The main draw for me was they had a wide selection of absinthe. I have not ordered delivery since quarantine started, mainly because they can't deliver the absinthe (and it would be pretty stupid to have that delivered anyway), but I plan to go back when quarantine ends.
column2407: Haven't been since the pandemic began, but this currently may be my favorite restaurant. Excellent food, and I love the warm, quirky interior.
column2408:
Solid escargot indeed. 
Fantastic French Onion Soup.  
Rustic Mushroom appetizer so yummy.  
Baguette perfect.  
Lamb hamburger was impossibly savory.  

The mixed drinks were finely balanced.  

Everything we ordered was deeply enjoyed.  
We'll be back for sure.
column2409: 85th and Greenwood Ave French restaurant - why not? The drinks and food are both great. We liked the french onion soup, escargot and steak frites. Voila is still our favorite French restaurant in the city but in a pinch this is a great spot.
column2410: An absolutely wonderful experience, our waitress was extremely attentive and had a wonderful suggestions. I had the French onion soup, and it was some of the best French and soup I had an a very long time. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone coming into town or anyone that's local!
column2411:
We came in here with a group of nine people and managed to find a table big enough for all of us! Friendly and fast service. This is a great place to come for a drink or three (especially the cocktails), and they also have a full menu with plenty of vegetarian and even some vegan options. They have a few non alcoholic drinks, I recommend the ginger beer.
Soup of the day was potato leek; vegan, good, but very salty. 
Beet salad was delicious, but it was supposed to have walnuts and instead it had almonds. That's cool with me, but if I was, say, allergic to almonds and not walnuts and I ate a salad I thought was safe and turned out not to be, that could be deadly. That's the only reason I'm taking a star off here. I think it's worth being really careful around substitutions with allergens.
column2412: Best burger there is - gainsbourger, add gruyere and bacon - patio is open, great beer options, great service.
column2413:
Edith Piaf $10: It had a slightly weird aftertaste to me. I think I've learned I'm not into creme de violette. 

Sinthesizer $12: I only tried a sip, but found it too strong for me. 

French Onion Soup $8: Really good! I'd definitely get it again. It was the right balance of savoriness for me. 

Macaronis Et Fromage $14: The mac and cheese is really rich, so the salad is a good side. I usually end up being disappointed in restaurant mac and cheese, but that didn't happen to me this time!

Frites $5 + Gruyere $1: They had just run out of gravy (late dinner for us around 10:40 PM on a Saturday), so no poutine for us. Poutine was what brought us here in the first place, as the Angry Beaver had their cook go home early so we already had been shut down for poutine once that night. The fries were nice and crispy. They don't use cheese curds here, so I am curious for next time how the gravy goes with the gruyere. We got a side of garlic aioli that was really tasty!

*****

My Star Ratings: 
1 Star - Terrible. Just thinking about it makes me angry. 
2 Stars - Meh. Unlikely for me to return. 
3 Stars - OK. Open to coming back, but wouldn't go out of my way to. 
4 Stars - Yummy! Will definitely return if I haven't already. 
5 Stars - AMAZING!!! Would plan my day or even a trip around eating here.
column2414:
I love the vibe of this restaurant, but I think the food could do with a bit more.

I've had the duck breast here, which was kind of overcooked and a bit salty. I've à huge weakness for duck breast and unfortunately this place fell flat. The burger (which is ridiculously cheap) during happy hour also left something to be desired. Worth the price but flavor was lacking, and it was literally just meat on a bun.

Drinks here are pretty solid and I'd definitely come in to enjoy some cocktails over fries and good convo!
column2415: Thrilled to find this spot a few blocks down the street while housesitting. Don't miss the every-day happy hour between 4 and 6 to get lovely craft cocktails, French cuisine and absinthe. (Though the usual prices seemed very fair, in my opinion). My choices were escargots and sauteed mushrooms plus the citrusy Edith Piaf cocktail and Mansinthe (good but pricey - they have eight options for absinthe, so I think I'll explore one of the others next time). The decor is dark - perfect for escaping a hot summer day, though there are also outside tables for sun-worshippers - with many an Eiffel tower, plus crystal chandeliers and mirrors to pop a bit of light back into the space.
column2416:
The happy hour is OUT OF THE WORLD. We have been here previously, and had gotten the entrees (steak frites and duck confit) - they were good but not too memorable, other than remembering the huge pile of fries.

This time around, I was craving French onion soup and saw that Gainsbourg serves it, so we made the trek. We were there just in time for the HH menu, and wow. We ordered almost everything on it because it was such a great deal!

Escargot - garlic/butter/herbs, tasty but wish it could be saltier. It comes with a baguette for you to sop the butter in, so no need to order separate baguette 

Baguette - nicely toasted with a generous slab of butter on the side. 

Olives - pretty good quality olives

Burger - we added a slice of gruyere cheese and it was heavenly. Only $7 with the cheese! It was an actual full/meaty burger. For the price, I thought I'd get a smaller burger. 

Fries - a MOUNTAIN amount of fries. For $2. I would've liked them to be more crispy, but they were still really delicious.

French onion soup (not on HH menu) - very flavorful! It was tasty but not the French onion flavor I'm use to (I was craving the French onion soup from Mon Ami Gabi in Vegas). 

Happy hour is from 4-6pm everyday, and all day Monday.
column2417:
Steak Frites and a nice Bordeaux. It's been too long! Full house tonight. 
Sitting at the bar is one of our favorite things, watching the dance of the Cook's..
I should mention that there is a duck French dip that kooks yum.
column2418: Probably my favorite restaurant in Seattle. Great food, great drinks, fair prices and a really cool atmosphere. steak frites and a bottle of wine is the perfect dinner.
column2419:
I love this place and I've been coming here for 10 years. Happy hour is incredible whether a carnivore or not, Lamb burger or beet salad? Heck have one of each Because you can afford it.
I've been on the search for a sustainable fish, that is good for me, the environment and that tastes delicious. The steelhead they serve at Gainsbourg is green certified from the Monterey aquarium, is raised in a fjord in Norway where the steelhead are free range to go up the river and come back to the sea. The best thing I've had since a local  salmon which of course I can't eat anymore because remember the Orcas?  Complemented by a perfectly sautéed chard and a seasonalcauliflower purée with notes of rosemary and sage. 
Pair it with what you will but I had a seven dollar house viogner and it was perfect. 
Bon appétit!
column2420:
Wandered in here for happy hour during the snowpocAlpyse of February 2019 because the grocery store was licked clean of provisions, and so I thought I'd finally try one of the walkable neighborhood spots. I do believe they were understaffed, combined with very busy, yet I was still completely delighted by the experience.

I loved the Gainesbourger (burger!) with frites. It's a great happy hour option. Also, their homemade ketchup was totally kickass. Usually I am repulsed by ketchup and imagine that it must be one of satans culinary creations, but Gainesbourg found a way to make it heavenly. Tastes like tomatoes should! 

I would hazard though the ice and slush to eat here again!
column2421:
Me and my husband came here on Saturday evening. This place had been on my list for a long time and I was really excited to finally come here. This place is really pretty and romantic! The panting on the wall and dark blue paint looked dramatic. And there was a black and white movie projected on the back wall! 

The place was not that busy when we arrived. When we walked in we seated ourselves which is always a plus since I'm very picky about which tables I prefer. 

The atmosphere was laid back. We started with some wine and snails for appetizer. Wine was great and snails were delicious. We spent rest of the evening with more wine, and some amazing food. My husband got steak which he really enjoyed. I went for duck confit which was cooked to perfection. Overall we had a great time!
column2422: Great Happy Hour, nice ambience and friendly staff.  Strongly recommended for everyone except under 21 unfortunately.  I left out a star because they don't have a seafood appetizer and the quality of the escargot has gone down over the years.
column2423:
My girlfriend and I love this place soo much. All night happy hour every monday! Fantastic food and great booze. The atmosphere is very relaxing and cheery. The people who work there are great too. Love how you can watch the chefs cook.

This is my happy place.
column2424: A dark, moody decor evoking a French bistro, with film noir playing on a loop on the unfinished brick wall. You will feel transported to the carefree, romantic post-war environs of a  boehemian Europe, although the feeling evoked is one of nostalgia as most places in Paris are more open and modern these days. The $4 happy hour escargot sauteed in the classic butter, garlic, parsley satisfies the Parisian craving, but where's the foie gras? The lamb beef Gainsbuger may not fit  to everyone's taste, but you will find many items on the menu that appeal to you, so sit back, break off a bit of baguette and revel in the joie de vivre!
column2425: This is our default go to neighborhood place for salads or weeknight dinner. The outdoor dining is good, tables spaced, touch less menus. Always nice service and relaxed vibe. Good beer selection and really everything on the menu is solid.
column2426:
Two words: Chicken Wings!  I mean...really!

This place is grate as a pub, sports bar, casual eatery. It's a pretty regular stop for my husband and I when we have a boat in the yard.  Normally he'd get a burger and a beer, and that's where he stayed.

But, since I'm a "wing nut," I thought I'd try the wings -- spicy wings, not the BBQ ones (not low-carb). And, when they said "one lb" of wings, they didn't mention that's SIX full-on drummettes. They are hot, zippy (they aren't "spicy" by my standards), fresh and NUMMY!  The last two times, we have made two orders our dinner plus either a small green salad or a caesar.

And, we were happy!  Comfortably full, tastebuds satisfied. And, I feel virtuous because I wasn't chowing through carbs.  Wine selection is decent, and hubby always finds a beer to enjoy.

Heather was our waitress last night and she was awesome. I have yet to meet a server I didn't like, but some have more personality than other.  Once again, Nickerson took great care of us and we'll probably be back i a week or two!
column2427:
This spot was okay. The service was great, and the food was fine. I probably should have tried a burger. 

We loved that we could sit outside with our pup on a gorgeous day. I ordered the southwest salad, and it was okay, but not the beat I've ever had, and the prices weren't cheap. 

I probably would not come back here based on my experience, and due to the plethora of great food in Seattle.
column2428: Tender meat in a scrumptious taco, beans are homemade taste awesome . It literally melted in my mouth
column2429: Great service!  Always drove by and finally stopped.  Nachos were good and the sirloin steak was great.  We will be back!  Happy to see they know how to pour a good Guinness
column2430: We came here on a sunny Sunday to soak up some sunshine in a cool place and that's exactly what we got. Heather was our waitress and she was excellent. She was incredibly friendly, fast, and checked on us constantly. I had the Greek salad and a Bloody Mary. Both were awesome.
column2431: Sweet spot in Seattle Craft beer, great burgers and meatloaf. Close to Seattle Pacific if you're going to a game.
column2432: Great service! Our waiter was very friendly. The food came out really fast and it was good.
column2433: Had a meeting close by and a couple people brought burgers from here and they looked incredible so I had to go try it after the meeting. Cool place, large and inviting. Staff was super friendly and service was fast! Great selection of beer, booze and food. Loved it! The Saloon Burger was huge and tasted great!
column2434: Such an awesome spot to wait out bridge traffic. Good food and a killer Mediterranean plate.
column2435: I love this restaurant, I grew up coming here. If I was to choose any restaurant to go to, this would be the place. They have a wide variety of food and drinks, and the service is amazing. The food comes out pretty quick and it always tastes amazing. If you live around here and want a good meal, go to this restaurant. If your looking to sit down and have a drink, this is also the right place to go. I give this restaurant 5 out of 5 stars because it is so amazing and the service is incredible.
column2436: A refreshing reminder of what once was. I'm thankful that the iconic Fremont bridge has a good neighbor in the Nickerson Saloon. They make a mean bloody mary and pour generously. Cheers to a Seattle institution.
column2437:
Kitchen Staff get's lazy as the night progresses....

I have ordered a 'grilled' sandwich as the hour approaches 'closing' time,  many times.  The sandwich comes out 'extremely dry toasted' (no butter or nice char) as the night time progresses.  Totally unacceptable!!!  Completely Sub-Par!!!

Food quality should be equal morning until night.....
column2438: Go on Wednesday's at 7! I've gone here a couple of times, and while it's always consistent and chill. Wednesday nights are pretty awesome! Live chill music, open mic and good people. Tiffany in the bar is amazing. And Tyler performs! Great crowd of people. I'm glad I found it :)
column2439:
I went to the Saloon for a team lunch. The service quality was excellent, we had our orders taken quickly and our food was served in a timely fashion (our party of 11 was in and out in around 50 minutes). In terms of the food itself, there wasn't anything really amazing about it and options are limited if one has alcohol or meat dining restrictions. I had a veggie burger with a Kaliber non-alcoholic beer (only option they had besides your normal sodas). The burger was better than most places I've been but the sides seemed a little below par either being too over seasoned or too bland.

The place is great for a large party to go and eat, but don't expect anything to blow you away.
column2440:
Have been wanting to come here for a while since they seem to be a popular summer spot for the ample outdoor seating space! 

Got the tri-tip sandwich with chimichurri sauce and it was really good. Had a slight smokey taste which I loved. Their sweet potato fries were crispy and not too greasy or soggy at all (like most places I get them). My bf ordered the burger and it was solid, no complaints. 
Good Happy Hour menu. Over all it seems like a cool place to come back and just hang out for a casual outing. Nothing fancy is expected here, but it's good! I'd definitely come back or recommend to friends in the area to grab some beers :)
column2441: I have lived by this place for years and the food is pretty solid. It's about the best burger and fries in the area and their salad with grilled chicken and their house vinaigrette is pretty amazing. My only complaint would be that it's a little pricey but that's often the case in Seattle. Good service, always get seated fast.
column2442: Been living in Seattle my whole life. Love this place. Great food. All staff are awesome!! We have a charity fashion show we run in Seattle every year and can't wait to ask if they want to be involved!!
column2443: A Landmark location at the entrance of Seattle's Fremont District.  It's an old school establishment offering traditional American fare in a bar-like atmosphere.  It's a fun place to check out the locals and watch the people in the numerous automobiles passing the establishment on the way to the Fremont District.
column2444:
So in Seattle, you have neighborhoods- (Queen Anne, Fremont, Ballard, Belltown, etc). Then you have the mini-neighborhoods that are in between (frelard, lower QA, Denny triangle, etc).  And while every mini-neighborhood might have a bar or two, they don't have anything like the Dexter/Nickerson mini-neighborhood has in Nickerson Street  Saloon.

Meals? Oh yes.  Good drinks, wine options, solid taplist? Always. Even a Scotch list? Macallan, Oban, Laphroaig, or Lagavulin... Even in a simple "saloon." Plenty of house cocktails, as well as a great happy hour option. Also some good choices for lunch and a ton of sunny seating for the warm-ish months (55 or more in Seattle...)

Yeah there are a lot of regulars, but ((gasp))they're really laid back and friendly and more than willing to be joined by new faces. Whether you want a pint, a happy hour plate, a full meal, or all of the above, this is a great place to keep in mind and try out.
column2445: Had a hankering for meat, potatoes, and eggs for breakfast and didn't have the ingredients nor the energy to make em myself. Decided to order delivery and see what the fuss is about. I was happily surprised! Crispy (even after being cooked then delivered) chicken fried steak, a super tasty gravy, and fluffy biscuits for me and a platter of thick French toast bacon and perfect sunny side up eggs for my partner. The food was seasoned well and the price was fair for the amount of food given, would definitely order from here again, and even eat here when dining is open again. If you're looking for a greasy spoon American diner type breakfast, this is a step up from that, in a really good way!
column2446: Pre-pandemic, I loved going here with my kids. It's always a bit crowded and a little loud especially on a Sunday, but it's worth it IMO.
column2447: Ordered breakfast delivery twice! Delicious and fresh! Pancakes are nice and fluffy. The Florentine eggs benny was my fave!! Their hollandaise sauce is tasty and good consistency. The waffles were also delicious!! Def add on a waffle to your order
column2448:
Lemon Ricotta Pancake 10/5
It's beautiful and I thought.. uhhh where is the syrup? But when I took a bite of it... pure bliss! The ricotta whipped with the lemon is amazinggggg and the pancake was fluffy and perfect... I could eat a whole stack omgggg 

Lobster Benedict 5/5
The Hollandaise sauce was well seasoned with the right consistency and they have asparagus in it that was cooked to perfection 

This was by far the best breakfast I've ever had!
column2449: Really HUGE servings. We shared a country fried steak, really yummy but super heavy and it came with two biscuits with gravy as well. Also ordered a side of french toast and pancake with a side of fruit. Solid good All-American breakfast and great service.
column2450: I ordered eggs Benedict for pick up today, Grubb Hub app said it was ready, ny husband went to pick it up and a woman said there was no order. I had to call she said it was in progress.  20 minutes later my husband noticed a to go order that had been sitting on the counter the whole time. So a super soggy English muffin mess. Horrible.
column2451: Over the top excellent. Fresh ingredients, friendly service. Pictured are the lemon ricotta pancakes and tostada Benedict
column2452: Entire place was full with indoor diners. Simply breaking the 25% capacity rule. It's a damn shame that so many businesses are so bad at following directions. I don't recommend to anyone who is COVID conscious.
column2453: I usually do not do reviews off one visit. But there is always an exception to that.  The waitress on this day was amazing. She was the only on doing all the dinning area duties. Seating, taking orders, assisting with take out orders, busing tables, sanitizing tables, keeping up everyone's coffee refills & of course bring out the food. This day they seemed busy for dine in & take out orders. All tables were filled since there is capacity limitations right now  social distancing was enforced as best they could in a smaller space.  Face mask required upon entry & around restaurant.  Our order was taken quickly the food was amazing & the service was spot on.  I travel to Seattle area monthly for work.  I usually do not do breakfast in restaurant type settings on these trips.  I can say moving forward I will be visiting this restaurant at least one day on my trips.  Thank you for a great experience & amazing food see you soon.
column2454:
Horrible food.  Horrible Service.

We moved to Greenwood in 2016 and for some reason had never tried this place even though on PLENTY (like 100's) of walks along Greenwood Ave with our dogs we see a line out the door.  Then, of course after checking Yelp reviews I expected it to be pretty good.  NOPE.  

We went on a Sunday (today) and got the last table in the restaurant at about 9am - that was great, sitting immediately.  But, that's all that was great.

Our server, Olga, was horrible.  (Also, I think her name was Olga because that is what the reciept said).  Anyway, she literally said one sentence to us the entire meal.  And, that was... drum roll... "Are you ready yet?"  THAT'S ALL.  She came to take our order, said "Are you ready yet?" and never came back.  Well, she came back once to drop off the check in the middle of our meal (and, didn't even ask how it was when she did that).  So, that was the service.

The food.  Tasteless.  I ordered the South of the Border omelet and my partner ordered the breakfast burrito.  The breakfast burrito was "okay" and the omelet was borderline disgusting.  No flavor.  I didn't even eat my hasbrowns cause they were so boring, and the single pancake we ordered to share with NOT worth the $3.95 they charge for a tiny little pancake that I can make at home so it actually tastes good.

All-in-all:  Do NOT bother.  Don't even try it.  Eat at home instead, or if you're out food just wait until lunch.  Not impressed.
column2455: Super good food and the server was really nice. Options on the menu are ample and the mimosa's we're good too!
column2456: Just wanna share with my experience. Pete's Egg Nest is a great place for brunch. My suggestion to order The Meat Benedict Breakfast. It was basically an Egg Benedict variation served with sausages and bacon. Incredible. Tried a Swedish Pancakes Breakfast  and that was also really delicious. The quality of food is excellent. Highly recommend!
column2457:
If I had to sum up my experience about this restaurant in one sentence it would be "Value for Money".
Food here is amazing and prices are really affordable compared to most of the overpriced brunch places in the area.
Also note that they serve their Benedict's and other egg breakfasts with 3 eggs instead of the typical 2 eggs that you get at other places.

We got the Eggs Benedict with chorizo and Athenian Greek Scramble. Both of which were delicious! The Athenian Greek scramble was so unique, it's the first time I have seen a brunch place give a Mediterranean twist to their eggs.
Every dish comes with hash browns and toast which you can swap out for fruits.

The ambience is pretty basic and not fancy, but who cares when you get delicious food at a decent price point??
This place is a winner on all accounts: Price Win! Quantity Win! Taste Win!
column2458:
When you've been a fan of breakfast and brunch dinings as often as I have, you kind of wonder what other types of menu items might jump out at you... for me and my first experience at Pete's Egg Nest, I decided to try the Pesto Florentine Scramble. Normally when I can eat meat, I'm super traditional and will go for the typical breakfast sausage, eggs, and hash brown combo but when I can't I always try to expand my horizon and try new dishes. 

I mean I love pesto, eggs, and feta so what could possibly go wrong? Nothing really considering I am giving this place 5 stars for the food but dinging 1 star due to service. The service wasn't horrible but it also wasn't outstanding. The restaurant wasn't that busy however our server took her sweet time to come to our table and take our orders... I asked her a few questions and she didn't seem so enthused to be working at that moment.

I don't really live up north so this won't be a frequent visiting spot for breakfast but I enjoyed trying something new.
column2459:
I don't quite recall how I stumbled upon Pete's about 5 years back, but I sure am glad I did! Every single time I have come here I have left with a very content belly and a great experience. What I love most  about this place is the small restaurant feel where the owners  and staff always make you feel like a regular even if you aren't here daily. 

As an eggs benny aficionado, Pete's is a staple. They have continuously rotating bennys that leave you wanting more! I've had some amazing concoctions here and I regret not saving all those old pictures so I can share. I've had some with a Greek twist (lamb meat, feta, sun dried tomatoes), your more traditional Crab bennies, Langostino, etc. Never have I left wishing I had ordered something else! Also their hash browns are LIFE. 

The staff is very helpful when it comes to suggestions. They're also insanely fast with their food delivery. I would strongly encourage bringing a few brekkie adventure buddies for you all to order something slightly different so you can try a little bit of everything.
column2460:
All around 5 stars. Great people, great food. You will never find hoity toity breakfast items like whipped scrambled eggs with creme fraishe and chives, but sometimes sticking to the basic is all you need. In fact, I found in quite refreshing. 

Portions were far more than generous and pricing under $12 for most plates. The three of us shared two breakfast meals and still had leftovers.
column2461: Cozy breakfast spot in Greenwood. Service is prompt. You can belly up to the bar if you're alone. I got the South of the Border omelette in the picture. Excellently cooked, almost burned a hole in my mouth which I definitely prefer to cold food! The portion is perfect in my view. The hash browns can be a major disappointment depending on the place. These were perfect. The coffee is a little weak, but that's to be expected at a place like this. Overall a strong recommendation!
column2462:
Ordered the corned beef hash and French toast to-go over the weekend. I forgot to take pictures because I was starving by the time the food was delivered. The corned beef hash was pretty tasty and the eggs were cooked to perfect over easy. The hash brown was also delicious and cooked to golden brown perfection.

The French toast on the other side was complete disappointment. The toast was not thoroughly soaked through so the egg was only a thin layer on the outside. I just tasted like normal toast to me. I was craving French toast all day so it was really disappointing. That being said, I would still go back to try other things because the hash was good, just won't order the French toast again.
column2463: This place was absolutely amazing. It's a small hole in the wall and I understand why there was a line of people around the block just for breakfast. The crab cake Benedict was delicious. We also had the pesto Florentine omelette and it was so flavorful. The staff was very friendly and attentive. I will definitely go back the next time I am in Seattle. Worth the 30 minute wait!!
column2464:
Holy moly!!! This place is amazing. Not crowded at all at 10am on a Thursday. Extra party points for having Coke products!!

We both had the special - Raspberry French Toast with two eggs and bacon, over medium for me, scrambled for him. $11 Eggs were perfectly cooked. Bacon was 2 huge slices, not to salty, and just crisp enough without being overdone.

The French Toast was the star of the show. Even with the Raspberry sauce, it was not too sweet, but I certainly did not need to add syrup. Coffee was good, too.

Service was superb! VERY pleasant, happy wait staff. Water without having to ask. Coffee never got below half full. 

We will definitely be back. Cheers!!
column2465: We just ate at the Baranof restaurant on Greenwood and OmFGoodness(!), we were both entirely impressed! We were told by the owner that they recently hired a new head chef from Mississippi and that the menu had been redesigned. The food here was always great before, but now it seems that everything in the menu could very well be 'out of the world' level of AMAZING. We ended up ordering the signature biscuits and gravy (made from scratch) with homestyle potatoes, the signature continental burger (super huge and perfectly prepared caramelized onions, bright red tomato and chipotle mayo on a grilled brioche bun) with fries + pickle spear and a bacon breakfast sandwich for later on brioche bun. The home style potatoes and crispy French fries were each the best I've ever had and WOW (: it was all just SO good. Congrats on the renovations and improvements. This has been the most pleasant surprise I can remember since the beginning of COVID 19 LOL.
column2466:
Owned by racist asshats. This place has always sucked. I'm really gonna enjoy watching them go out of business. 
Byyyyyyyyyyeeeeeeee.
column2467:
If you wan  a dive bar, want to get your wine in a little airplane size bottle and listen to crazy Karaoke this could be your spot. 

The nautical theme is a a lot of fun. But boy it's a dirty dirty place with  a nasty bathroom and sticky everything. pretty gross. If you are drunk enough you may not mind. 

Also, the people that come here are super friendly, the bar tenders not so much. They seem pissed to be there. I've been about 4 times and they are always grumpy. Maybe that's the tough vibe they go for? 

All in all, come to hang out and sing and meet new people.  Wear shoes and clothing you don't care if they get dirty. It's more like being on a real boat.
column2468: The Baranof is a great local dive bar - but it is a dive bar so know what you're getting into! Don't be put off by the restaurant in the front. The bar is in the back and difficult to get a sense of from the street. Great karaoke and jello shots!
column2469:
I've only been here for breakfast on the weekends so that's all I can comment on. 

The breakfast is quite good and quite cheap. I recommend the eggs benedict. I've had this dish 3-4 times now and it's been good every time. The hollandaise is buttery and stays together nicely. The hash browns always come up crispy and hot.

The atmosphere on the weekends has a relaxed vibe. I have never felt rushed to leave. The owner even asks me if I want to borrow a newspaper when he has one.

I took a star off because it's pretty dingy inside.

Keep in mind this is a dive, so if that's not your thing then I don't recommend this spot.
column2470:
This is where old alcoholics go to die.  I enjoy this place because after a couple drinks you get to see what a lifetime of alcohol abuse looks like.  I always come out of here feeling like an all-star.  

Ladies, this is the #1 place in Greenwood to get your purse stolen.  

Party on.  Early bird gets the tequila worm at this place.
column2471: I love the Baranof. I have been a regular there for about five years. Karaoke is great and it seems everyone likes most of the staff. Food is good, especially for the price. Very down to earth customers, comfortable. Oh, and they have Jell-O shots!
column2472: Screw you guys, came in on a Tuesday night, sat in dining room, waited, waited, waited..nobody came around. Went in the bar,  waited, waited, waited for the bartender to finish filling ice or whatever and she still ignored me. Adios...if I want to be ignored I'll go to my ex-wifes house
column2473:
Unbelievable! $23 for breakfast?#!
I've never felt so ripped off. And the waitress got offensive when I asked why. She said the Irish cream that she drizzled in my coffee was $8. The same breakfast at the same place was $11 just one year ago.  Also the plack on the bar that my friend who passed away purchased was gone.
column2474:
Omg....after waiting nearly 1 hr for my chicken fried steak brekkie; we left. The waitress had come back to ask what I ordered about 15 mins later. Then another waiter asked if I ordered organic chicken...what?  Hubs ordered a bloody Mary and it came in an old fashion glass...short and full of ice not filled with mix and vodka. We came because of write up in Weekender.
We left and went to Ballard to Hatties. Much better...service and food is top notch! Bloody Mary is excellent.
column2475:
I wouldn't come here  again by choice. The service wasn't good and I got a major stomachache after eating their steak. 
The steak had no flavor and the mushrooms had an acidity taste. I think what was what gave me the stomachache.
column2476: now i'll have to come back... new owner and all...  what a great little local bar... the beat goes on....
column2477: This bar is nothing but fun!  stiff drinks and karaoke is awesome!  the lady bartenders are great!  the food is delicious and the drinks are strong!  also i win at pullbtabs when i play there!  im never lucky when i gamble!  lol
column2478:
Subpar to mediocre fare served up out of their respective food service cans and boxes by somebody's surly mom. The well liquor is likely turpentine or Monarch. Either or; they're equally detrimental. The drinks are poured with a heavy hand so your liver will need a day off if you *do* decide to play alcohol roulette here. 

It's a proud dive. There are usually a few old guys smoking out front in the mornings. There's karaoke in the evenings so you can drunkenly laugh at other idiots drunkenly trying to belt out hair band ballads. The Baranof is a solid middle of the road experience, nothing fancy, not that bad.
column2479: Couldn't picture a better Saturday breakfast. Veteran staff that want to charm you and connect with you. Inexpensive comfort food with always extra servings thrown in. Unique murals and decor from another time. This is not a forgettable place. I watched every person who walked in get big ol' smiles. This is a dying breed of restaurant that I want to ensure stays alive.
column2480: Weird, funky Sunday breakfast place. No service at all for 20 minutes, but we were in no rush. Eventually we were treated with humor and good food.
column2481: I love this place its a a great lo key dive bar that has awesome food and excellent service me and my fiance love the denver omelets and they are HUGE! I am a ham freak and never want to order a denver omelet because i feel i get less ham in it..not here these babys are loaded with everything! And its hella cheap too. And as for the bar you aint getting a shot measured and pored outa a  fountain gun thats for sure your getting a SHOT WITH ATTITUDE. Good peeps hang there too its old ballard/ greenwood at its finest check it out you wont regret it.
column2482: Myself and three friends went to the Greewood Car Show on Saturday June 29th and decided to stop at Baranofs for breakfast. The service was very slow and the servers were not pleasant at all. When our food finally arrived it was a disaster.  The food was absolutely disgusting and tasted like some type of chemicals.  We left the restaurant feeling sick and instantly and ran straight to the restrooms.  The men's bathroom were disgusting as well. This restaurant should be reported to the Dept of Labor and Industries Health and Safety Board. I was forced to leave one star in order to post this but is not deserving of this dump.
column2483:
Wow, what a place! I was told that the drinks were generously poured here and they were!
The people are friendly and the prices were very reasonable. 
What I meant by people was that the service and the clients were all very open to just having a good time, whatever the reason was that they were there for. Everyone had a good time, dancing, singing, and just making the most of the bar that feels like home.
column2484: Live close to the Baranof and stop in now and again (earlier the better). Not many bars like this exist in Seattle anymore. Obviously not everyone's cup of tea, but I appreciate the place. Generous portions when it comes to breakfast and the servers always remember what my order is (creature of habit). Stiff drinks at the bar in the back as well. Seems like regulars have their usual seat at the bar, so I always just order my drink and take a seat at one of the tables. Greenwood is changing fast these days - I'll be sad if this place leaves.
column2485:
Food is great and outdoor area feels good with good airflow and outdoor heaters. In the time of covid, revel makes it feel a bit normal again. 
My favorite dishes are the bowls, but almost everything I order is delicious.
column2486:
Wonderful outdoor dining experience on a warm evening.  Everyone was social distancing and wearing a mask. Tables were spread out enough to feel spacious. 

Enjoyed the drinks variety from Hite Korean beer to a fancy cocktail. Sauces were a hit with our kids. They even have a kids meal! 

The standouts were the short rib bowl with the incredible egg yolk and the chocolate mochi cake. 

We got a reservation and went at opening at 5:30. It did get busy and many diners were turned away so make a reservation!
column2487: We had a delicious dinner, seated inside with plenty of social distancing. Service was very attentive, drinks were good and the food was simple but amazOne of my favorite dining experiences!
column2488:
I was excited to be back at this restaurant after a coupe years and the food was not good as I remembered. The Dungeness crab noodles were too salty (too much sauce for the small amount of noodles) and the baby back ribs weren't any special. It did not fall off the bones.

The restaurant was a little cold inside because  they kept the door open. If I knew, I would have worn more layers. That was not really an issue though. But they let a staff who was just covering his face with a bandana serve dishes. Bandanas are not masks...
column2489: The pork belly rice bowl was really good and the service was friendly and attentive.  I think I just expected more from this place and it sort of fell flat. They did well with the spacing and covid guidelines.
column2490:
Great fusion! The crab noodle & the beef bowl is mouth watering good!

Our server was very nice and patient despite them closing up.
column2491:
Revel deserves much better rating than it has! Going here I was expecting a 3 star restaurant and was pleasantly surprised!! Our waitress was amazing and encouraged we get the Dungeness crab noodles and the Korean pancake and both were really good!! The dungeness noodles are a must have, and I loved the trout, also a fun must try dish!
If you are looking for authentic, cheap Korean food this probably won't be what you are expecting but I'm promise you will be pleasantly surprised! More of an Asian fusion restaurant with some classic dishes (kimchi, pancake) but also some very yummy dumplings, etc.

Seemed like a great place for drinks on the town, if you are looking for that!
column2492:
Loved this place! It deserves better reviews! 

Let me premise this by saying that I am a connoisseur of Korean food. I lived in South Korea for two years and ate kimchi and rice every day. I love Korean food and eat it every chance I can get. 

Revel isn't the most authentic Korean food. It's not your hole-in-the-wall, Korean mom and pop shop. But that doesn't mean it's not amazing. It's a lot more trendy, unique, and fun. Think of it like classic Korean food but with a gourmet, modern twist. I loved it! Really cool place. 

We ordered a few of the dishes that our waitress recommended and they were all outstanding. Some of our favorites were the Dungeness crab noodles and whole trout. The flavors were so complex and delicious, great sauces and cooked to perfection. We ordered some classics like the dumplings and the kimchi pancake too. And of course, we got some cabbage kimchi (the true test of a Korean restaurant). It was well done. 

The restaurant is modern and cool. It's located right on the Main Street in Ballard. Our service was great too. It was a little pricy but not too crazy for high quality food. 

Try this place out!!
column2493:
The chicken skewers were flavorful. Their sauce was delicious. But it was overcooked- the texture was rough and dry on the inside, and rough and crunchy on the outside. Comes with only 3 skewers normally, but we asked for 4 to share.

The dumplings were burnt. Normally, dumplings are soft and juicy- the outside is tender and the inside is flavorful. Not the case with these dumplings. Comes with 5 dumplings, we asked for 6.

The service was decent- could have been slightly faster considering there weren't very many tables seated at the time, but our server was nice, efficient, and helpful. 

The interior is dim with low orange lighting. Intimate atmosphere. Average amount of tables. Small bar.
column2494:
I was so excited when Revel 'came home' so to speak. I have great memories of their old location and like most in the neighborhood, I was ecstatic to have them back. 

Things have changed and it shows. The service is still great but man, it's just not the same Revel. 

First off, it is really pricey for what it is. A salad, which basically consists of a small portion of mixed greens and a dressing costs $10? It's a side salad anywhere else. Also, no lamb salad! I repeat - THE LAMB SALAD IS NO MORE! What a sad day. People had mentioned this on social media but I had to see it to believe it. The staff had no recollection of the salad and wasn't sure as to why it is no longer offered. Shame, it was the best salad in the city and reason alone to come. 

The dumplings were good but they should tell you how many come in an order as five dumplins for $14 is steep. Also really salty, so there's that. 

The kimchi is good and I loved the fennel version. However, it's so crazy that 'modern' korean places don't include small banchan with the meals. Kimchi should be a given, not something I have to pay $10 for (yeah, ten bucks). 

The crab noodles are fine. The al dente noodles are what you want but the flavor has changed and the magic is gone. The short rib is cooked perfectly but lacks seasoning and overall the bowl is pretty one note. 

I donno, for a salad, dumplings and two entrees and some drinks it comes out to being at least $50 a person to dine here. Sadly, I have to say this, Revel is no longer worth it. A victim of its own success or just forgetting where it came from, I am not sure. However its spiritual home has not revived a once stellar dining spot. 

To me, it just seems like another overpriced pan Asian restaurant which are available in spades in this city. I'd much rather go to Paju or get the real deal down in Federal Way or Lakewood.
column2495: Our second visit to Revel and still enjoy the food and service. We ate on the patio and they were busy on a Saturday night so reservations are a must. We had the crab noodles, pork belly rice cake and the beef wonton app. All of these items were delicious. Also had the short rib rice bowl and I did not care for that. Meat was way to fatty, daikon was tasty but the dish was also 80% rice. I won't order their rice bowls again. They had an ube dulce de leche dessert which is amazing. Cocktails were tasty and overall very nice dinner.
column2496: I was really so excited to see the new building when I found out they had moved back to Fremont that I didn't eat all day. I had to save space cus I knew I was going to be eating the crab noodz and spending time with my best friend drinking here. The new places is huge, very modern and beautifully space. Still love the open kitchen concept they have going. Service was honestly amazing but I was really sad when the noodles came out because I waited so long to have them. The flavor wasn't as prominent as before. It wasn't strong in curry flavor. I was really sad hahaha. Luckily the katsu pork bao helped a bit and the drinks we ordered were delicious. Hopefully it was just an off day because I'd hate to have to find a new noodle place hhaha.
column2497:
I would say everything is fine but rather overpriced. Yes, it is in South Lake Union but it still seems a bit extravagant for Asian fusion compared to similar restaurants in the area. They also charge 20% mandatory gratuity: as someone who normally tips 18-20% regardless of service, this still felt a bit slimy. If you're going to make tipping "mandatory", then just include it in your menu prices and pay your wait staff a living wage. If you think it will give customers sticker shock to do this (i.e., to be transparent about pricing), then reconsider your business model. This is not to speak poorly of the wait staff here--in my experience they are all friendly and helpful.

Dumplings and noodles are both decent: nothing to rave about but nothing specific to complain about either. I tried a few bites of someone else's rice bowl, and I think the best thing I ate was the beef in that dish. Overall I'd say the best feature of this restaurant is its capacity for big groups. You should definitely make a reservation if you're going to come with a group at peak dinner hours, but they do handle large parties well
column2498:
This place is in the heart of South Lake Union so it's no surprise it's kinda pricey. The food was good and I got the Kalbi streak bowl which was $19. If I worked at one of the giant tech companies I guess it makes sense to spend more than $20 for lunch, but I'm not about that life. 

I wouldn't go by myself and it's pretty nice and everything, but if I was going for a nice sit down lunch this would be a great option. Lots of better grab and go choices around here though. 

The food was great and I really liked the mix of everything. The rice was cooked great which is honestly all I can ask for and I really liked their little spice tray deal. 

Anyway it's not a cheap option, but Seattle isn't cheap so this is still a place I would recommend!
column2499: We went there for the holiday lunch of our group. It was located close to South Lake Union and I liked their holiday decorations. We did not make an reservation and were seated along the table without waiting. Simple menu featuring Asian and Korean style foods. I had the rice bowl with tuna. Although it was not full when we were there, it took at least half an hour before our foods were ready. The rice bowl with tuna came with green veggies and kimchi. Liked the seasoning of the tuna as well as the veggies. But the rice was really disappointing being really hard to chew. I guess a little bit more water  when steaming the rice would be much better. And when we were ready to go, we found soda that we did not consume appeared on our check. We were lucky to have someone in our group who had sharp eyes.
column2500:
This was a recommended lunch place by a coworker. Got the pork belly pancake and the dungeoness crab noodles for lunch a few weeks back. These are my notes. 

Crab noodle was nice. Could have used more of the white sauce

Pancake was okay. Nothing overly special

As for the accoutrements:
-Nice sweet Korean sauce
-miso paste was really salty
-the fish sauce was touted as being spicy. There were quite a few jalapeños in there but it took a lot to get the intended intensity imho.
column2501:
They had a new spring/summer menu! The portions were pretty good! The experience was good and the ambience was also classy! It was pretty busy for lunch on a mid weekday! They had enough dishes for a vegetarian/vegan person! I tried the sesame pancakes and the grilled tofu rice bowl! The flavors were very rich and delicious! I loved the ginger flavor powering the dishes! It was definitely fresh!
They add a default gratuity to the check irrespective of the size of the party and the service.
column2502: We came from out of town to spend some time in the big city.  We knew Anthony Bourdain ate at this restaurant and wanted to give it a whirl. It was really good! The crab noodles was amazing, the half chicken was amazing. Thanks guys.
column2503: A bit hard to judge exactly, since it's COVID and they're offering a modified menu with outdoor seating and service only. We ordered the crab noodle bowl and it was pretty good, smallish portion size but good flavor. Mike really liked it. I'd like to come back sometime and try this place for real (sit inside, non plastic utensils, etc.).
column2504:
Been going to Revel for 10 years and unfortunately they have really lost their spark. Not only is the food basically the same as 10 years ago but smaller portions and higher prices. The rice bowls don't come with a selection of sauces like they used to. The kimchi pancake is $10 and the size of a pita bread. If you go to standard Korean restaurant in Shoreline or Federal Way, the same $10 kimchi pancake would be loaded with seafood and bigger than your head. Service is always great but if the food isn't great then what's the point? They really need revamp the menu and consider lowering their prices or offering more at that price point. 

In addition they have a 4% service charge that doesn't go to the wait staff who you still have to tip on top of their service charge. I asked the waitress who handed me a pamphlet from Rachel Yang about the service charge and solicited feedback about he charge. I wrote her an email suggesting the surcharge felt misleading and all I received was a copy and paste of what was written on the pamphlet as a reply from Rachel Yang. 

Sorry but I think I'm not going going to Revel anymore. Plenty of family run Korean restaurants that offer delicious food at reasonable price.
column2505:
Portage Bay has the best brunch in town! I think their prices are really fair, they use organic and high quality ingredients, and they have really great portion sizes. 

I almost always order the Rancher's Breakfast, it's the best of both worlds if you're a sweet and savory kind of person. I got the chicken sausage, 3 eggs over easy, roasted potatoes, and 2 French toasts with EXTRA whip cream (they have the best homemade whip cream) and berries. 

Normally their pancake/French toast bar is unlimited toppings (berries, maple syrup, whip cream, etc.), but I ordered takeout and the amount of berries and whip cream they gave me was perfect! I did ask for EXTRA whip cream and boy did they give me EXTRA - but I appreciate that! 

Awesome brunch place with great happy hardworking servers too!
column2506:
My husband and I went here twice in September. They have outdoor seating for anyone concerned about sitting inside due to COVID. They have hand sanitizers at each table. The tables are spread apart with a safe distance.

My husband got the dungeness crab grilled sandwich and I got the dungeness crab benedict. The sandwich was amazing! The pesto sauce is divine and the sandwich was perfectly grilled. My crab benedict was a bit on the dry side. It could use a little bit of sauce. The second time, we got the french toast. It is scrumptious and so fluffy. I got the crab sandwich because I liked it so much the first time. The portions are good size and very filling.
column2507: Great college vibe and and indoor seating is back! I had a yummy mango lychee mimosa which was the best mimosa I've had in a long time! I got the migas with chorizo, and it was pretty good. I didn't love that it was wrapped in a giant flour tortilla instead of the fried tortilla chips that normally come with migas, but the inside was yummy, so five stars!
column2508:
10/10 would not recommend. If you're looking for an overpriced brunch restaurant that serves food you can easily make at home, then this is your place. 

I came here with one of my friends for a brunch meeting. We made sure to book a reservation as this place is known to be popular during the weekends. Upon entering, we were pleasantly greeted by the waitstaff and was promptly seated to our table in the left hand side of the restaurant. I decided to try the french toast to see what the excitement was about the toppings bar. When my order was ready, I received a plate to use separately to retrieve my toppings at the fruit bar. 

I was highly disappointed by the selection as the fruits were not fresh and Portage Bay used frozen fruits. Being a serve yourself fashion for the toppings bar, I was ultimately highly disappointed by the selections as they had a small selection of frozen fruit and a couple of nuts. Upon tasting my french toast, I felt as if it was bland even when paired with whipped cream and frozen fruits. I don't understand what the hype is about for this place and will not be returning.
column2509: THIS IS AMAZING !!! I love this place !!!!!! The hollandaise is sooooo creamy and delicious , you have to eat here if you're visiting seattle. MUST TRY!!
column2510: My friend and I came to portage bay for a brunch date and I was pretty impressed! Very cute atmosphere and location, if you want to sit outside they offer blankets (individually wrapped in new plastic) and hand warmers! I got the mole verde burrito; it was good but lacked enough seasoning. I loved the egg on top! Overall I feel like it was a bit expensive for what it was worth, $17 for a burrito that was mostly beans and crema in comparison to the amount of meat :( I also tried the grapefruit mimosa which was beautiful! I would come back again but maybe stick to something simpler, prices not worth the portion
column2511:
This place is just a classic. You get you're classic breakfast food, sizes are extremely generous, service is amazing, and taste is always spot on.

I came here with friends after making a reservation online. We were a little hesitant about eating indoors due to Covid, but they do a pretty good job of spacing out all tables and such. I do wish that they would somehow regulate people waiting around the front entrance because people were starting to get pretty close especially for Covid reasons. Other than that, everyone was wearing a mask and I felt like precautions were taken. 

I was really craving a yogurt parfait so I tried the granola and yogurt. Vanilla yogurt was super creamy and they give you A LOT of granola and honey. Personally I love granola and honey so this was perfect. 

My friends ordered the Farmer's Hash, Breakfast Sandwich, and Egg's Benedict and loved them all. Portion sizes are huge so you could probably split a meal between two people or have leftovers for later.
column2512: I came here for my birthday breakfast and was seated in the outside tent. There were heaters and warm blankets available. For my drink I had the mimosa with pomegranate tangerine juice. A first for me and a very unforgettable beverage. The tart of the pomegranate was a perfect match with the brut. I ordered the bananas foster French toast. It came with homemade whipped cream and a medley of berries. The brioche bread was fluffy and properly soaked. The creamy caramel sauce was not overly sweet and the banana still had some life to them. The fresh berries and whipped cream topped it off just right. The blueberry and banana combo was a home run for me. Thanks for an amazing birthday breakfast!
column2513: Love this place!! I've met the owner last time I went in who was going around different tables thanking them for coming in. How nice ! The food always is amazing and the service is great also. Best brunch in Seattle!
column2514: One of my family's favorite brunch spots. Great for both savory and sweet dishes. The oatmeal cobbler french toast is my personal favorite, but any of the dishes hit the spot.
column2515: Had a glorious New Year's Day brunch at this location. They have TONS of covered outdoor seating with heaters and blankets available. I got my usual: gluten free banana pancakes with a side of bacon and it was delicious as always. Because of COVID they're bringing a single serving of their famous fruit topping bar which is a fine compromise to still get that delicious berry mash!
column2516: Great great great spot for breakfast or brunch. The vibe and energy in this place is amazing. The staff is friendly. I went on Halloween and everyone was dressed up. I made a reservation and they seated me as soon as i got there. The waitress was extremely nice and helpful. The food was great. The blueberries were not sweet and the table was a bit small but how were they supposed to know i was gonna try the whole menu  cant hold that against them. Overall really good spot to go to!
column2517:
Easily one of the best spots in Washington. Also, this may be the best quality of all the Portage Bay restaurants.

Every-time we come by this location we can get a table and service is so prompt. I love everything on this menu. The avocado toast is a must for any meal. The farmers hash is truly a surprise. For someone looking for healthy but still ... rich almost in texture and flavor this is the plate (bowl actually) for you.

The Dungeness crab is amazing. The flavor isn't too fishy and the texture is perfectly crisped on the outside. Watching that egg yoke flow makes me mouth water.

ONE THING I WILL SAY! The biscuit here is actually filled with cheese SOOOO please, don't be shocked by the flavor. First time I ordered it with jam I got a weird look, I was eating it and was like why is it so salty and cheesy? Am I hallucinating? No, I wasn't. So the staff may giggle but it's a fucking delicious ass combo!

Thanks for always having a Seattle, the best service and quality of food. Huge fan and so grateful you're still open during this time.
column2518: They have amazing eggs benedict, especially in different varieties if you want to stray from the traditional eggs benny. I had one with pulled pork shoulder, yum!!! My only thing with this place is they charge a lot for basic coffee. Just go ahead and order water, but the food is worth the visit.
column2519:
It's as if I died and went to sustainable and locally grown heaven.

The menu has a list of where they get their groceries from and how far it is, to demonstrate how locally grown things are -- I've never been to a restaurant that has done that before and they should be proud!

The Ginger beef omelet was great, the garlic stir fried bok choy and mushrooms inside complemented the egg. The Ginger sauce drizzle wasn't overwhelmingly ginger, but savory. The thick wheat toast with butter was so good, I only wish I wasn't as full so I could finish my plate. The wheat bread is so good. My bf had the uli's spicy scramble and it was spicy from the jalapeno but not too spicy. We got a pitcher of mango and raspberry mimosa to share and it was tasty. Since they use nectar for the mimosa, it looked kinda thick, the sediments might settle in the glass, but no big deal. This place is popular for good reason. Come have a bomb ass brunch!
column2520:
Started when I called in a to-go order. I had two separate order and when I told the server I'll be there in about 30 minutes and they can put the orders in to be made in a few, she said she couldn't do that cause the first order was already being made. (Mind you she said they were CRAZY busy moments before). So how is the order I told her about 10 seconds ago already being made? 

Anyways, I ordered the Ranchers breakfast ($20) my eggs were NOT over easy like I asked. French toast was sub-par, and it looks like they give you twice the berries if you dine in (which is unfair because I'm paying the same amount)

They are also NOT able to keep up with being clean at this location because the only pens that were available to sign my slip were in the "dirty" labeled bin. If safety is not a priority, you shouldn't be open. 

Last and not least, they forgot the order of bacon that they charged $7.50. We drove 30 minutes to get the food and they said we have to come back to get a refund. You really think we're driving another hour round trip to get a  $7.50 refund AFTER the experience was so terrible and our breakfast (for two) we paid $40+ for? No. We will not be driving back for refund. Instead, I'll share my experience on Yelp, Facebook & Google reviews so others don't have to be treated so poorly.
column2521:
I'm usually not a brunch type of person, but anytime someone suggests to get brunch, this is my go-to spot. There are two main things here that makes Portage Bay stand out from your typical brunch restaurant. 

First, the food quality. The food here is great and each ingredient always tastes of high quality. The food here isn't necessarily cheap but neither is the quality you're getting. Everything just tastes really nice and fresh. My favorite items are probably any of their hashes - I can never get tired of them!

Second, their breakfast bar, which I'm a huge fan of. If you order a breakfast food that includes the breakfast bar option (something like pancakes, french toast, etc.) you can take your plate and fill it up with whatever fruits, nuts, toppings, or creams you want. I think this is a really cool idea that makes dining here a more unique and fun experience. 

Some other things to note: the wait can be long but they do take reservations. There is a free parking lot. Service was solid. They also change their menu depending on time of day, whether it be their breakfast menu or lunch menu, but generally their menu is easy and simple, nothing too fancy. 

Overall, my favorite place for brunch even though I don't like brunch!
column2522:
Came here for brunch yesterday.
4 stars overall. 3 stars for service that is much too slow.

Came with reservations for 11:45, and showed up at 12. I understand that this is in part this is our responsibility to show up on time, but did not expect to be waiting until 1 pm, after ALL other reservations and people who were just walking in as no-reservation customers. Then, once we ordered, we waited another HOUR for the food. 

It was pretty packed yesterday, so I understand that makes it very hard for workers // tables to clear up, but my warning is this -- MAKE RESERVATIONS (and come exactly on time to them -- or else you'll be pushed all the way to the back of priority) 

In terms of food/service once we were seated;
Service 5/5  -- other than having to wait forever to get seated and for the food to come out, the servers are very attentive and my water/coffee were never empty. 

Food 4/5 -- French toast was good, especially with a trip to their breakfast bar ! I was quite pleased with it, and like that they give you the syrup on the side so i can adjust sweetness as I like. Family members also enjoyed the crab benedict and steak and crab egg dish (? menu names i'm not entirely sure)
column2523:
Always a solid option for brunch! Their ingredients are locally sourced and they always have delicious seasonal dishes. Lately I have been going more on the "sweet" side since you get a trip to the toppings bar which includes toppings such as whipped cream, fresh berries, canned peaches/pears, nuts, brown sugar etc. most recently I got their sweet potato pancakes which were amazing! The farmers market bowl is also delicious. You can't go wrong with whatever you order. 

I will say that it can be very busy over the weekend. Be prepared to wait, even if you have a reservation. Also, don't plan on lingering bc of the long waits you may be asked kindly to wrap up right after you pay. Staff were nice and attentive. Due to the crowds some requests were forgotten or took a long time.
column2524:
Brunch institute in Seattle and I have been going to here for many years. It's never a disappointing experience - always straightforward, clean and simple menu items. My only problem is that it's always so busy that sometimes you don't get a seat. Otherwise, there has never been any complains with service or food. I find their motto very quirky and very Seattle. 
Try this place and they have a couple other locations. And you will enjoy a great  breakfast/brunch.
column2525:
5 stars to the view, customer service, timeliness of food, and how well they uphold COVID standards.

The food? 3 stars on average (lower if the main entree is given more weight).

- Clam chowder? 4 stars. Has bacon, so salty is expected.
- Bread? 3 stars. Reminded me of stale bread or cooled dry toast, but let's be real here: the bar for free bread is set pretty low.
- Blacked salmon Caesar salad? 2 stars. Salmon was decent, salad was not (almost no flavor, and watery at best).

Will I go again? Yes, but I'll order something different.

Note: my waiter mentioned that the Salmon House is temporarily closed as of 9/28/2020. Not sure when they'll reopen, so be sure to call in advance if you're hoping to dine in or order out at this location.
column2526:
Nothing much better than pulling up dockside and putting a take out order at Ivars on a sunny day.

Today's weather hit the 90s and luckily we found an open spot dockside to pull up and place an order. We grabbed a variety including the Cajun fish and chips which are a must if you prefer some spice.

You are able to place an order ahead which is recommended if the dockside is crowded. We wore masks to go out and place the order and we were able to take it to go and enjoy it on Lake Union.
column2527: Came here with my husband for a evening snack. Food was good. But they kept switching our orders. We tried the classic fish and chips but Cajun style. And also the salmon fish and chips. Nice staff. Only dining out or take out. They are following CDC guidelines.
column2528:
My hubby and I stopped there yesterday. It is one of my favorite Ivar's! It's not a dine in restaurant, you call out your order and someone will ring you up. Social distance isn't in effect here. The outside tables are put away to discourage gatherings. The place seems clean and the people are efficient and friendly. 

The food is always so good!  I had my usual clam chowder bowl and fish/chips Cajun seasoning. I was so full and satisfied my craving. 

I love this area!!
column2529: Salmon lovers rejoice! Ivar's is dedicated to all things salmon, the best fish - change my mind. They have a great patio right next to Lake Union with breathtaking views and a lovely atmosphere. The restaurant is huge and on the pricey side, but it was the perfect place to go to relax after a tiring day of hiking and driving! My sister had the entree that came with three different types of salmon and all of them were so good ( i obviously had to sneak a bite of each )
column2530: Now this was a real treat! The chowders pretty salty so it's a once in a while only kind of lunch but it was pretty neat. Due to all the new safety guidelines, you are served soup and the bread bowl separately in your to-go bag and make it at home as you wish. Loved the flexibility of this and totally did my own thing with the bread. I warmed some of it and ate it on the side and had the leftovers later. I was super impressed at the packaging of everything though!
column2531:
I dropped by for happy hour. I was visiting Seattle and heard the Salmon Chowder was delicious. It did not disappoint ME. It was so flavorful and delicious. The Salmon pieces and potatoes made it so hearty and rich. It was yummy to my tummy. It was refreshing not to have to eat clam chowder. I want more salmon chowder. I also tried the mango wings. They were ok nothing special. Another appetizer I sampled was salmon kabobs. The sauce was heavenly, but the salmon wasn't seasoned enough. 

For my drink I had a blood orange martini. It was perfectly made. The bartender was great and was able to give me food information as a tourist. 
I left happy and full. The salmon chowder was definitely tasty and the highlight of my happy hour.
column2532:
I came here about 5 years ago for prom, because of the waterfront view. At the time we were on a tight budget so we only had the fish and chips. Now that I have a little more income I was able to enjoy the main entrees. Starting off with the appetizers, we had fried calamari. It was very large enough to serve 6 people. I came here with 4 other people and there was a lot left over. I got the seafood linguine and the portion was giant. There was a mix of clams, muscles, scallops and various fish. Over green linguine pasta. My friends got the salmon, halibut and chowder. They said the salmon needed sauce, like a white garlic butter or soy sauce. Over all the servers are very nice and attentive. We were also able to sample some of the wine before ordering. Which I didn't know you could do.
